Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for almost everyone visiting Seattle.”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is welcoming and interested in being as helpful as possible. Rooms are very clean and, considering this is a city, quiet. They're also comfortable and come with microwave and minifridge. The breakfast stand has good food but is somewhat confusing with items not clearly priced. Thev complimentay shuttle is one of best I know of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Studio Suite Doesn't Work”
Reviews.Author: LWS-NYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice property and convenient to the University of Washington. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. Restaurant recommendations were mixed - breakfast recommendation was good - dinner recommendation was mediocre The studio suite - advertised as twice the size of a normal room - good for families - doesn't really work for more than two people. While it may have twice the space, the layout and built-ins don't provide privacy for the third person or a person using the bathroom sink. Also, as the TV does not pull out or swivel, it is not really visible from the sofa/sofa-bed. Mattress on main bed was OK, not great. Mattress on sofabed was normal for sofabed. Free and fast wifi. Mini-fridge and a microwave in room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern room with great view!”
Reviews.Author: Rita8740
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay at Watertown. King view room, 3rd night free deal made it an excellent value. Lovely view of mountain, city skyline. Very friendly staff, free underground parking, washer/dryer on each floor was a big plus. Comfortable bed, very spacious bathroom area. My only 2 issue: I hate the new Tommy Bahama soap, shampoo,etc that they have now. Very fruity, icky smelling, used my own instead, used to have nice, normal stuff...Also, instead of fitted bottom sheet, they have a regular sheet tucked into mattress-comes loose easily. All in all a great place though!

Reviews.Title: “Update since I last stayed here”
Reviews.Author: theorchidlady
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel a year ago and liked it so much we gave it a great rating on Trip Advisor. We returned to Seattle again in November 2011 and once again stayed here. Unfortunately, there had been some changes in the hotel which left us feeling that we needed to update our review. First, when we were there in 2010, they offered a lovely free breakfast. When we went in 2011, we were informed that they no longer provide a free breakfast, though we could now buy breakfast. Second, the hotel has changed to the new trend which provides liquid soap in a container on the wall rather than providing a bar of soap and a small bottle of shampoo. I felt both of these changes significantly downgraded our experience at this hotel and when I returned to Seattle in March 2012, I chose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: madprofessor
Reviews.Content: Watertown Hotel is a relatively new hotel. My husband and I have stayed here whenever we visited Seattle. We like it very much and recommend it to our friends. Its location is convenient, close to the University of Washington and the U Way, where there are nice book stores, restaurants, and theaters. The hotel has modern design, clean and bright. The room is big, quet, and comfortable. The management offers free choices of DVD player, computer, etc. They even provide free shuttles to downtown every hour. Besides, there are also a washer and a dryer, very handy when we stay for more than a week. But it's a pity that they stoped offering free breakfast, which used to be quite adequate. Most of the staff are very friendly and helpful. I appreciate it when they allowed us to check out late, for we had an evenin flight. Above all, the discount in the low season (i.e. Third Night Free) made our last stay here even more pleasant than usual. We'll definitely return to this lovely hotel. By the way, Village Sushi on the 12th Avenue and Chiang's Gourmet on the Lakecity Way are very good. Try them!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room design and free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: ChocFrog75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Watertown two nights during a recent visit to UW. The location is very convenient within University District, only a short walk from restaurants and from Campus. Staff were very helpful and friendly when I arrived and asked for some information on the area. The bedroom was very large, with an interesting design that had the washroom/toilet area separated by a partition from the sleeping area, in a way that the room looked like a small studio rather than a standard hotel room, which I thought was a nice change. One downsize is that the heating was down to an old-fashioned wall heater/conditioner which was very noisy and clanky - so I avoided turning it on, meaning that I was a bit cold overall. Another plus of this hotel is free wi-fi - an invaluable especially when travelling for work. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “New management and changes are not so positive”
Reviews.Author: Shantap
Reviews.Content: I have stayed religiously at the Watertown for a LONG time, probably 20 visits or more in total. My brother lives nearby and I am from Boston, so I stay here on all my family visits. The hotel was a hidden gem, as other reviewers say. Small, cozy, clean, modern, organized, simple but tasteful, quiet, and a good location. It has changed. I just arrived last night, and noticed two main changes: 1) Instead of Aveda soap products, they now have Tommy Banana dispensers (feels more like a Sheraton or Hyatt or Hotel 8), and 2) the free breakfast area is now a pay-as-you-go cafe (which few use because of this). Lastly, they have not updated the furniture or carpets with the merger. So, what you get is a hotel that is starting to fray a little around the edges (it was about time for some cosmetic upgrades anyway) too. Also, because I used to stay so often, I could get the best room for a very reasonable rate. That seems to have changed now that they have been bought/merged. This is still a good hotel (average to slightly above average). It still has some of the feel and flavor of the old "Watertown". But it has changed. I would probably come back, out of convenience. But I would also look around more in the area and over in Wallingford and Freemont. I would look at B & B options, and other options in the same price range and comparison shop. Before, I wouldn't think twice about coming to the Watertown.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice near UW”
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here multiple times over the past 2 years while visiting the UW campus. It is about 4 blocks from the edge of campus (depends on which part of campus), very near the main campus retail, coffee shop, and restaurant area, and generally has a great college vibe. The hotel is a remodeled older property with a lot of room character. I have always had the larger "suite" rooms, which have a couch and chairs seating area in a great room layout with the bed nearby. There is a little bar area with a sink and Keurig coffee maker, which is a nice touch. There are only a couple of cartridges in the room, but I always have a coupe in my bag. I was disappointed the free buffet breakfast, which had a lot of fresh choices, disappeared in favor of the Pineapple Cafe, which is okay but nothing special. Plus, you now pay for coffee. I had some business meetings downstairs, and it was a good location as no one is there. Mystery to me how the cafe makes it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: PA88
Reviews.Content: The other reviews indicate what a nice hotel this is, so I’ll just add a few notes. First, we stayed in the larger sized room (double the size of the basic room) and it was well worth it. Nice touches include a lot of counterspace in the bathroom to lay out all your stuff, a wooden bench, larger sofa bed, mini-refrigerator and small microwave, and Keurig coffee machine with a selection of coffee and tea pods. Instead of those tiny bottles of shampoo and bar soap that doesn’t dissolve in water, this hotel has liquid dispensers (see photo) which I prefer. The toilet/tub room has a motion sensor that operates the fan, which is very quiet. The hair dryer afixed to the wall also has a built-in night light. The room comes with 2 terry-cloth bathrobes of the kind you find in hotels (thick and heavy so you won’t be tempted to stick one in your bag on the way out). The king bed was high quality with good quality linens and comforter. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel doesn’t provide a free breakfast. Instead, they have a Starbucks-like coffee boutique with pastries and light food. It’s open until 2pm, after which the management puts out reasonable quality free coffee and mini-cupcakes in the lobby. The free parking is underground and the spaces are tight. We had rented a compact car with this in mind and it worked out well. Security is good; a key card is required to access the garage and to operate the elevator. Internet is via free hotel unsecured wireless. The hotel lobby has a pantry with drinks and snacks you can buy; there’s also a grocery market across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good option.”
Reviews.Author: JHS60
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property since it opened. We like the secure parking and the van to the downtown. The rooms are efficiently appointed and have quality linens and towels. We were disappointed to find the complimentary breakfast replaced by the Pineapple Cafe, where limited items may be purchased. It's not as good as it used to be, but we would return to the Watertown Hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: vicsoz
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th/5th visit to the Watertown but the first time since it was taken over by Pineapple. Previously, I found the service and 'extras' next to none but i do feel it has slipped. I e-mailed them twice before I arrived and failed to get a reply which was unusual and a little frustrating. The complimentary breakfast is no longer and it was so convenient when you had a long day ahead of you! The delicious cookies are also no longer and replaced with tasteless cupcakes and although the room was extremely clean (as before), there were things missing that were there before. I am not sure if they still do their 'a la cart' which offered certain luxuries but I saw no reference to it. The free, secure parking is excellent and the free wi-fi in reception is also useful. Our stay was comfortable but as others have said, it is slipping and I will look elsewhere in future before I book the Watertown again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfotable”
Reviews.Author: Gawdpdx
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be in the U District. Staff was friendly. Not particularly good on restaurant recs, but then they wee pre pretty young. Rom is large and the bed comfy. Wifi was fast. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a hidden gem now it's an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsBeam
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Watertown when in Seattle on business for the last 3 years. I loved all the special perks that made a business stay turn into a pleasurable experience. The last time I stayed at the Watertown was over Christmas on a personal vacation and I was very disappointed by several things. It has been sold to the Pineapple company (or, some such name) and there is no complimentary breakfast, there are cheesy pineapple cupcakes in the lobby, there are no longer Aveda products, or good coffee in the rooms. The perks are that it is in a great location, there is free parking, internet, and the service is very good. There is nothing wrong with the Watertown now but it is not as special as it used to be. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious”
Reviews.Author: ting w
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again. Needed a place to stay near UW, this place is across the street! It was big, spacious, came with coffee maker, microwave, mini refrigerator, and FREE PARKING! Can't beat the price and location. Very close to cheap eats near the university.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good but slipping”
Reviews.Author: Flufton
Reviews.Content: I still like the Watertown for location and basic comfort but it's slipping in quality on some little things. They used to offer a continental breakfast bar. No longer. Now you have to pay for pre-fabricated sweet rolls and coffee. I walk down the block to the Portage Bay Cafe for breakfast instead. They also changed the soaps and shampoos in the rooms. Now it's liquid soaps in dispensers and they are not good quality. They have a "chemical" smell to them that clings to you all day. The in room coffee changed to those machines that take a capsule and make one cup at a time. Last two stays there my coffee machines didn't work and had to be replaced. And the coffee isn't very good either. But I still get a good night's sleep and there's on sight parking.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms in this Modern Delight”
Reviews.Author: awarrick
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very spacious and had nice amenities in the restrooms. Great location for business at or around the University.

Reviews.Title: “Practical and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: julofalltrades
Reviews.Content: We were a family of three. We enjoyed the layout of the room, the way they made it feel also like it had a kitchenette without taking up too much room. The window coverings darken the room nicely for sleep. The off-street parking was much appreciated for such a busy area and in the pouring rain. We didn't eat in the hotel cafe because our children wanted to go to Portage Bay Cafe down the street (terrific breakfast menu!). The staff was kind enough to give us another half hour before checkout. In the evenings, the lighting was a bit dim in the sleeping area, but the bathroom area was well-lit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: travelduck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown while in town visiting my son for the holidays. I found everyone to be friendly and helpful. When I found out that the continental breakfast had been discontinued recently, the clerk offered vouchers for free breakfast at their cafe. The king size bed was firm and the most comfortable I've had at a hotel, but I did flind the very slick sheets to be a little annoying, as the comforter slid off at night and things became untucked. The Keurig coffee maker In room was nice, as were the bathrobes. We enjoyed our view of the city at night. I can't wait to return in warmer weather, when we hope to make use of the complimentary bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: FrumpSLC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Watertown Hotel while visiting my son for Christmas. My room had a wall of windows that overlooked the Seattle skyline including the Space Needle with it's Christmas tree on top and Mount Rainier. The room was well appointed and clean with a comfortable bed, plush towels, spa bathrobes, keurig coffee maker and Tammy Bahama bath product dispensers. The staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. The hotel is within walking distance to the University of Washington, shopping and restaurants. The Pineapple Cafe within the hotel has the usual coffee shop fare (lattes, bagles, croissants). I had a wonderful breakfast a block from the hotel at the Portage Bay Cafe which had organic, local choices. Being vegetarian I am always looking for somewhere that offers more than a salad or veggie burger. I found Pizza Pi in the U District while on this trip. It is all vegan food. I had the best pizza. I will definitely stay at this hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in the University District!”
Reviews.Author: mzqb
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Watertown hotel while in town for business at UW. The hotel location is perfect for it's close proximity to campus, UW hospitals, and downtown. For under $100, the hotel is a steal! The room was much nicer than it looks in the pictures. Great layout, very nice bathroom. Bathrobes, Keurig, fridge and microwave were a plus, not to mention free wireless and parking! It's the best deal and nicest place out of all of the surrounding hotels if you ask me. The cafe in the lobby opens early if you want a latte or pastry before you head out, although within a square mile, there are plenty of fantastic food options. The room was quiet and the bed was comfortable. I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was, and definitely think it's the best bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: D_Alan101
Reviews.Content: I struggled with how many stars to give since the hotel isn't bad but it sure isn't what it used to be. I've been staying here for almost ten years now, at least 20 nights a year and up until this year, I'd never stay anywhere else. But unfortunately, the hotel was purchased by Pineapple Hospitality and it's not the same. The bad. First, there is no more free breakfast, there's a crummy little "cafe" that serves the basics, but if you want something other than Starbucks coffee, go across the street. Even the Starbucks isn't free until 2:00 in the afternoon. Second, the shampoo. They used to have great Aveda products, but now they have soap/shampoo/conditioner that all smells like a cheap Pina Colada. Take my word on this, YOU HAVE TO BRING YOUR OWN SHAMPOO ETC. The stuff they have is really really bad. If you like a hot shower, you might be disappointed, sometimes the water is almost hot but some mornings just tepid. Not a chance that you could take a hot bath though with what comes out of the tap. Internet can be quite variable. Some days pretty fast, some days painful. I've frequently had to go down to a cafe if I had work to do which required a good fast connection. The good. The staff is generally friendly and the housekeeping staff is the best anywhere. All of the housekeeping staff have been here for years and they remember me by name when I come and the cleaning is impeccable. The towels are fluffy and big, the beds good, the room layout is unique and not at all sterile, and there's free underground parking (though I was told they have talked about starting to charge). Compared to the other choices in the area it's still a great deal. If you like to walk to dinner there are many choices within a mile so the location is hard to beat. So compared to what it used to be--I'd give it one star. Compared to other places in the area, I'd give it 4. I'm on the lookout for somewhere else to stay (and if they start charging for the parking I will) but probably not in much of a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Fun”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: The softest most fabulous towels on earth, filtered tap water in the rooms and a great staff. Beware of the Tommy Bahama automaticlly dispensed hair conditioner. It's not a detangler! It instantly turned my long hair into a tangled mess. I thought it got confused with the similarly dispensed shampoo but it is really the conditioner. The breakfast bar can't compete with similar class hotels doing hot breakfasts but it is adequate and everything else is positively wonderful. BTW is is THE place to stay if you're going to husky stadium. The hotel shuttle driver took us over and was sensitive to our timing. When a second pickup wasn't ready and couldn't find their tickets he asked them to wait for the next shuttle so we could arrive on time. We had a short walk back after the game. Will definitely return when the Ducks play the Huskies again (after the stadium remodel). GO DUCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: anhemp
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Nice modern hotel with free parking in lock up garage underneath. Staff were very pleasant. It was our honeymoon and we received a bag of goodies as the guest of the day. Room was good size, clean, modern and looked towards seattle skyline. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Bandwidth Hog”
Reviews.Author: geefour907
Reviews.Content: That's me--total e-nerd/geek. And when I tested the Watertown's bandwidth: 43mbps down/11mbps up...it was awesome. I was sooooo happy to have honest-to-goodness high-speed internet, I almost stayed up all night editing videos. HA. LOVE this place. I'll stay here again. Forget the hotel's bready-bread continental breakfast. Stroll down 1.5 blocks to Portage Bay Cafe. EPIC! Beds--comfy. Sheets are particularly cushy. Very nice weave. The TOWELS--omg, they are so BIGG and FLUFFFY. Room layout was very nice. I did notice all the amenities were squeeze-your-own, all the lights were the florescent kind. The closet was very cool--opened both to the bedroom and to the bathroom on the other side, where you could pull out the ironing board for the finishing press. HA. Like I did that. HA. I worked out twice during my stay--so I took advantage of the free guest laundry--and I parked in the free lot. Free parking....what a concept. HA.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dmc52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend wedding. Close to the main street for football, shopping, restaurants. Nice room, decent breakfast, quiet. Keurig coffeemakers, microwave and refrigerator. Market across the street from the hotel has great sandwiches. Shuttle bus available for trips into Seattle, main attractions. Easy walk to the UW campus. No street side parking so checking in is difficult. You can park in the garage but it is hard to spot and the hotel does not advise you of this option ahead of time. We circled the block a few times-all one way streets.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: AlexNCollins
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here. Staff were fantastic, and we received a free room upgrade by checking in on FourSquare. The location was fairly central for Seattle proper, however, it was a 15-20 minute drive from downtown. The hotel offers complementary shuttle downtown, and that worked great for us. Lots of perks like free parking, breakfast, microwaves and fridges in the room. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Urban, cozy, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Allergictraveller
Reviews.Content: Traveling with allergies is a challenge but this hotel made it a lot easier. The rooms were clean and beds/pillows did not make me sniff. It was a treat to be able to open a window and let fresh air in. On top of that the free breakfast provided lots of healthy and low allergy options. Hard boiled eggs, plain yogurt, real fruit (cut up oranges when I was there) and bagels: simple but honest food. A microwave + shopping around the corner made life easy for the rest of the day. If you need to be close to the University of Washington, this is a great place to stay. Now if only they could do something about Seattle weather......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_Hill027
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while we were on a college visit to UW. Extremely convenient location, easy walk to UW, shopping on the "Ave," Trader Joe's etc. Rates are great for what you get - rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Free parking and free laundry are just an added bonus. We had excellent customer service - front desk personnel were extremely friendly, professional and helpful with suggestions. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I Really Liked It Here”
Reviews.Author: bombshelter
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here. We booked over 21 days in advance & got 25% off, but we didn't find out until we got there that you couldn't combine the 3rd night free coupon with this offer. But for the money you get a very spacious, clean & comfortable room. I liked there were 2 sinks, one in the bathroom & one in a separate area for making coffee & tea, or cocktails if you're so inclined. We had a refrigerator & microwave. The large closet contained fluffy bathrobes, a safe, drawers, lots of hangers & ironing board. The bathroom area was also very spacious & the towels are big & fluffy too. We were actually on the road 6 nights before getting here, so the free laundry service (a washer & dryer is located on every floor) was really convenient. The free breakfast was perfect for our purposes. We found the staff very friendly. The location is pretty good as you can walk to University St. & there are tons of food & drink options. If you want to go downtown, they have a free shuttle service or public transportation is nearby. There is also a mini-market right across the street. I found the bed to be comfortable. I also liked that they refreshed the shampoo, conditioner, etc. even though I hadn't used them all up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel away from Downtown”
Reviews.Author: fridomac
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Watertown at the start of our tour of the Northwest. Having stayed there 6 years before, we knew what to expect and were not disappointed! Service was great, our room had a great view of the city. A definite plus is the free parking, so we could either take the hotel shuttle or public bus to downtown or our rental car to Gasworks Park or Magnusson Park (Kite Hill) to enjoy the nice summer evenings. We´ll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Particularly good for families”
Reviews.Author: BKT48
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several good hotels in Seattle, but the Watertown is my choice for a long stay. We were here for a week in July, staying in a very large, simple, comfortable room with a good bed and sofa bed, and a great view of Mt. Rainier. A few of the family-friendly aspects: free breakfast, free laundry, free parking, lots of closet space, microwaves and fridges in rooms, walking distance to many reasonably-priced cafes and restaurants. The art carts, spa carts, movie carts, etc., are a great idea, though we didn't take advantage of them. From the 21st-century-worker point of view, this is also a great hotel: wi-fi connectivity is good and consistent, there are LOTS of accessible electrical outlets in the room, and the work desk is modern and uncluttered and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel If You Need to Be Close to UW”
Reviews.Author: birdmanbilly
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle for a University of Washington football game. I booked the Watertown Hotel through a 3rd party site. The rate was a lot cheaper than going through Watertown directly. Most hotel chains price match or "offer a lowest rate" type of deal but I did not have the time to do research on this. I needed a hotel, read reviews and just paid. Time was not on my side. The hotel is very new. The decor is modern and clean. Nice king size bed, and a flat screen TV. Large mirrors and many power outlets. Our room was adjacent to the elevator and never at any moment did we hear hallway traffic or noise. The Watertown offers a breakfast buffet which includes all your basic pastries, yogurt and fruit. There are bagels, hard boiled eggs and different types of milk and juice. It is basic and does the job. WIFI is also free. It is unsecured but for checking basic email or news it does the job just fine. The hotel is adjacent to the AVE where there are many places to eat of different ethnic origin and at reasonable prices. Walking to and from the AVE is a few blocks so keep that in mind. If you don't want to walk you may want to consider another hotel. Right across the street is a convenient store that has a good selection of beer and snacks. Husky Stadium is dry so if you want to get your drink on stopping by this store right across the street is a good choice. There is a shuttle but we didn't take advantage of it. My GF and I ended up walking to the AVE and catching the bus to Seattle Center and Downtown. For those who are into bus riding and want to get to downtown just remember 71, 72, and 73. And when you want to come back to the U-District remember to go under Westlake Center and use Bay A. Some people have mentioned issues with the customer service, our contact with customer service desk employees was minimal but they did answer my questions and inquires. If you are going to a UW football game or dropping your college son/daughter to UW I would highly recommend this hotel. There is a walk to the campus but it isn't too bad. At the same time just be aware of your surroundings during the evenings. There are homeless that live on the AVE but if you keep your head on a swivel and are just aware of what is around you then you should have no problem. Also when booking, keep in mind the hotel room taxes. The price that I was quoted from the 3rd party site was over $50 bucks less then what I actually paid. The fine print is there but just keep in mind that the Seattle hotel room taxes when booking any hotel--not just this one.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay at the Watertown”
Reviews.Author: la811
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at the Watertown and we enjoyed it once again. A helpful low-key staff, comfortable room with nice amenities and a good breakfast buffet included in the rate. If you are OK in this part of town (it's our preference - and we had a car) then the value for the cost (free parking too) we recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Negatives beat out the positives”
Reviews.Author: Carla181724
Reviews.Content: There are definitely many good things about this hotel. The price is very reasonable, the rooms are laid out well, the location to many local attractions is excellent and the complimentary shuttle was great. However, we had too many negative experiences that have convinced us not to go back, regardless of the free night promotion we received (which they changed on us at the last minute and we had to fight for it). The front desk was one small step up from useless. THREE times we went to see them with what we thought were simple questions and the people working there knew nothing and came right out and said they don't actually work there and were just covering for someone else. Did they offer to take a message? Nope, they just said they didn't know and we would have to come back. When we did find someone who knew what they were talking about, they were unfriendly and dismissive. The front desk seem to be run by over-tired, hungover college students who couldn't care less about the guests. Although the beds weren't horrendous, they do leave much to be desired. The comforters and sheets were either overly starched or really cheap... they were SO noisy with every movement. I was up most of the first night, with every toss and turn of my family. The carts... yes, these sound like a great idea. On our last day there, we planned to reserve an art cart for our kids while we packed up. The evening before I approached the front desk to do this and got the "I don't work here...they told me I wouldn't have to worry about that carts thing" so I phoned the front desk first thing in the morning. She said that an art cart was available but it was on the 4th floor and she was by herself and couldn't get it. A few hours later, my husband went out the door to start loading the car up and a cart was sitting outside (who knows how long). This cart looked nothing like it was described. It had a few sheets of construction paper, a few colouring pages printed off the computer and a box of worn out crayons and felts that didn't work. The small paint sets were pretty much empty. Where were the scissors and glue and art supplies? Not there... The trip ended with a miserable student checking us out so we left frustrated and with no intention to go through that again. I think if we went there with expectations of poor employees and service, it would have been fine but after reading all the positive reviews on here, we had such high expectations that we couldn't help but feel completely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Stillwater54
Reviews.Content: Very Comfortable! Excellent quality! This hotel is almost like being at home. Very Comfortable Rooms! I almost never sleep well in a hotel the first night. I slept great! Very Quiet even though my room overlooked the street. The staff is very friendly and they know the area! The complimentary breakfast is very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely will be back”
Reviews.Author: sunvalleygal
Reviews.Content: Watertown Hotel is very conviently located next to the University of Washington Campus. I was visiting my son in Phinney ridge and this was the closet best place with the most ammenities I could find. The rooms are super clean and very modern. A euro feel. Best of all it is 100 % non smoking! I love the fact that they have a free shuttle to downtown and provide free bikes to ride on. I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cemcemm
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a room downtown but decided to change to a hotel which was a little more "budget friendly". Imagine our surprise when we discovered this little gem of a hotel! It was clean, modern, comfortable, stylish, great location and price! The shuttle availability was great, they even provided booster seats for our small children. Don't let the location fool you, it is a short car ride to all attractions but provides a quaint, university neighborhood filled with cute neighborhoods and many food options. Will be staying here next time in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well appointed, contemporary decor”
Reviews.Author: Wandering20082008
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful room. Although we didn't use them the "carts," e.g. the art cart, is a great idea. Wonderful pillows too - generally a neglected item. And a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel w/many amenities; close to UW”
Reviews.Author: redoctober30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at the nearby Univ. of Washington. The hotel was easy walking distance to campus. The room was clean and everything was new and modern. The hotel is very quiet and the staff was always nice and friendly. Breakfast was easy and plentiful. They offer a free shuttle to downtown and the Space Needle, which makes getting around a breeze (you just have to book it in advance). Bonus for the afternoon pineapple cupcakes in the lobby. Also, there's a market right across the street that sells snacks and sodas. The towels are the softest, most luxurious towels I've ever had in any hotel! But, the sheets are really stiff and uncomfortable (my only complaint). Overall this hotel is a great value. I would stay there again. Tip: to get to the airport, just take the free shuttle downtown and pick up the Link Light Rail at the Westlake Station.

Reviews.Title: “They Suck!”
Reviews.Author: jonibalderaz
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk Manager, Antonio, is very rude and condesending. The hallways and elevators had horrible stains on the carpet. The room had white animal hair all over the seats, which Antonio said "must have come from a coat". The room also had stains on the carpet and a very bad patch job on the ceiling. The maid service only replenished one bottle of water (2 were in the room upon entering) daily. The breakfast consisted of the exact same thing daily, with the dining room over crowded, and staff standing around talking and not cleaning tables, garbage, or replenishing the food. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable Place”
Reviews.Author: Flufton
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times when I travel to Seattle. It's in the University district north of the downtown area-a couple of blocks from the University of Washington. It's away from the noisy city center but just a five or ten minute drive to all the city attractions. About a 30 minute drive from the airport. There's free underground parking. It's a very comfortable place. Beds are good. TVs are new. Free internet. Free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in the University District!”
Reviews.Author: ADJPDX
Reviews.Content: The Watertown Hotel is a really great place to stay in the University District. The rooms have lots of windows (and blackout curtains), are very clean, tastefully decorated, well laid out and extremely quiet. The toiletries are Aveda, the style of the place is quite contemporary, the beds are quiet, and the complementary breakfast is perfectly fine (buffet style eggs, meats, toast, yogurts, coffee, juice, etc). Usually when we go to Seattle we stay right downtown, but now that I know about the Watertown, I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Hoopester1972
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Watertown and were totally satisfied. with our accommodations. We had a basic king bed room and enjoyed the bright, airy room. I liked the bathroom layout which allows for privacy. We took advantage of the free shuttle downtown and our driver was very helpful in getting us oriented. The location of the hotel is perfect for people who need to be close to the university and surrounding neighborhoods. I will definitely stay there next time I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Balance”
Reviews.Author: Tenshi20
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The convenient U-District setting, enormous king suite, and friendly service really makes this one of my favorites in Seattle. The design of the hotel and the rooms is a breath of fresh air. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in U-W area”
Reviews.Author: davidbViennaVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in early July 2011. Very stylish hotel with well-sized rooms, nice amenities is the bathroom, a microwave and fridge, and a nwe LCD tv. The continental breakfast was not as big as others I have stayed out but there were enough muffins, pastries, bagels, freshly cut melon, cereals, yogurt, etc. to satisfy all. We received a "back" room which was great because we could see Mt. Ranier out the window. Unfortunately, on July 4 at midnight, some people decided to light some fireworks in the alley behind the hotel which woke me and several members of my family. The hotel also has bikes available for free and I did a morning ride along a nearby bike trail that parallels the ship canal that was quite lovely. The neighborhood is not upscale, but with free parking and the entrance ramp to I-5 just a few blocks away, it didn't matter! Only negative comment was it took awhile to get "carts" from the front desk (they have activity carts with games, art, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Watertown Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rjose
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Watertown a Unique Urban Hotel for three nights (May 26th – May 28th) and I was so pleased with the service and the staff that I felt the need to put it in writing. I was in town for my sister’s White Coat ceremony at the University of Washington and at first I picked the hotel because of its location. I knew it was a fairly new building so I figured the inside would be pretty modern and clean. To my surprise, the hotel exceeded my already high expectations! I reserved one of the suite corner rooms and was amazed at how much space there was! The room was fully equipped with robes, Aveda products, flat screen TV, ironing board and iron, tons of towels, a washer and dryer (located right outside my room) and the cart where you can order games or arts and crafts was such a genius idea! Moreover, the continental breakfast was great quality. Most continental breakfasts do not have any hot items so it was to my delight (and my family’s) to see that they offered offering eggs, bacon and sausage along with their delicious pastries, fruit and good coffee. What I liked the most about this hotel was the staff. Specifically, the staff who were in charge of taking care of the Continental breakfast – they were very, very kind. I don’t remember his name but he is a Hispanic man who has semi-long hair (Manuel?). He was so very kind to me. After having my breakfast I wanted to stay and get some work done on my laptop. I asked him if I could possibly stay and I promised I wouldn’t disturb them while they were cleaning and he replied, “Si, es su casa” meaning “yes, this is your house.” I thought he was so very nice and seemed really enthusiastic about his job. Additionally, I loved the Aveda products offered in the room so much that I asked one of the cleaning ladies if I could possibly have an extra set and she was more than happy to hand me one, no extra charges! She too was very welcoming and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Still Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: UW-Neighbor
Reviews.Content: I live two blocks from this hotel but needed a place to stay during repairs in my building. I had a top floor room overlooking Roosevelt and had no issues with street noise. I can attest that hallway noise will come through but that is the case in a lot of hotels. In my case there were multiple guests with kids on that floor so at least I wasn't having to listen to drunks but be advised its not 100% soundproof. I found the room design interesting (in a good way) but the bathroom was small and nothing to get excited about. There were what appeared to be crayon marks on a couple of the walls and I let the staff know about this and took digital pictures for my records. But the room was clean and acceptably appointed regarding the furnishings. It had a modern feel that was nice. I think the concerns about possible cost cutting are worth noting from other reviewers but this remains a good value and pleasant place to stay in the area. The design and atmosphere is contemporary and relaxing. For first timers to Seattle this is a good alternative to more expensive places and there is ample public transit to get to where you want to go. The fact that it is in a working residential area is a little nicer than being downtown. I liked the fact that to get to any floor of the hotel you had to be in possession of a card key. Living in the neighborhood I can add that Roosevelt is a street that is busy most of the time with cars and foot traffic which is good as there are usually people around. Late at night apply the same street smarts you would in any unfamiliar city. Arguably the neighborhood is safer overall than downtown Seattle but it is possible to get into trouble if you aren't paying attention. If you are the drinking type the further north you go on The Ave the sketchier the bars get, as a general rule. Overall I would recommend the Watertown as possibly the best of the non high end hotels that I am aware of and certainly a usable location for both tourists and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice and Value”
Reviews.Author: ValuingTraveler
Reviews.Content: I used to really like the Watertown; now I'm just so, so. I've been staying there for several years, mostly due not to its proximity to UW, but its ease of navigation from just north of Lake Union. If you have a car, it's far more economical and efficient to explore Seattle offerings from this base. But it is not the Pike Place Market/ Pioneer Square walkable venue which more intown (and expensive) hotels will offer you. Good value, decent accommodation for putting down your tired head. Five years ago, it had a hip, different edge to it. Nice fresh fitted sheets on a firm mattress and comfy towels, cute specialized room offerings (zen tray, etc), and a tasty continental breakfast and afternoon cookies. But it has leveled off in this area, both through its own apparent inertia and the market moving beyond it. The bedding is not as taut, the towels have been put too many times through the wringer, and the food is sad. This is Seattle, a foodie mecca, and you will discover that the food service seems to be sourced by Sysco. Do you really want to be reminded of Tang and Walmart/Sam's/Costco bonus muffin packages while facing your overcast new morning in Seattle? Hopefully the Watertown will rebuild its mojo in those areas and restore its brand. It's a nice stay and could be goosed up to an excellent one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antarctic
Reviews.Content: Certainly not one of the standard chain hotels than are common in the US. A quite quirky room design which I liked. Good size mirror, washbasin and facilities although the bathroom was cramped by comparison with the rest of the room. Although a fairly new hotel, some of the furniture and fittings show use and could use attention. The breakfast available each day within the room rate was ok but could have been a bit less formulaic. After 4 days of the same breakfast, more choice would have been welcomed. The receptionists were superb and very helpful. Very difficult to advise what the other staff were like as the hotel appears to operate on low staff ratios. I liked the hotel and would return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Mary47
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night trip included 6 family members and was mainly to see the university and environs, but we also wanted to see the Seattle sights, and the location was good for both. The staff was perfectly nice about various requests regarding our various room and parking needs. We especially liked the layout of the rooms, and the little cupcakes and coffee in the afternoon. The rooms were clean and quiet, and breakfast was good. Many restaurants are within walking distance; one we especially liked was Araya's for vegetarian Thai. Our only (slight) difficulty was with the tight parking spaces in the underground garage. However, we were not charged for parking. The 3rd night free promo made our stay economical.

Reviews.Title: “The bedspread stunk of men's cologne”
Reviews.Author: rozee18
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Watertown several times over the last few years and had been pleased, but on our last stay experienced the stench of men's cologne which suggests - well, it screams that the bedspread had not been laundered after the last guests' stay. We were frankly grossed out. Also, the rooms are looking a little tired - curtains faded and paint marred. A shame, for this was a great place to stay in the past.

Reviews.Title: “100% smoke free stylish with nicely designed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Veni-vidi-vicidotcom
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay north of Lake Union, so after a lot of research online and my local relatives, we stayed here for 3 nights. Very clean, new, nice underground parking which cost $10 (I think) per night. The elevator goes from the garage right up to the room level with your room key. Felt secure in a "University" type area which was 5 blocks to a lot of restaurants. Comfy beds, AVEDA products, robe, coffee machine, fridge, microwave, popcorn, better than at home. The only little downside was that the breakfast for hot food wasn't ready when they opened, so my 2 year old had to wait for her eggs and bacon or not get them at all. It was free, so one can't complain too much, except she was up at 4:30, so waiting until 6 was still a long time. The staff was really nice and they had a "general store: for sugar and the like at the front desk. The room was rather quiet despite being on a busy street. Well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MSNDIS
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here one night with my teenage daughter and her friend because of an event they were attending at the UW. This is by far the best value I've found in the Seattle area. I made my reservations online through the hotel's website by using the BEST promo code and ended up with a price that beat other online travel web sites. This is not a high-end upscale hotel but the little touches they provide rival, and beat, some Seattle-area high-end competitors. They do not nickle and dime their guests to death. For example: 1) the secure, underground parking is free; 2) they provide loaner umbrellas at the front door which are needed in the Seattle area--my daughter's friend didn't bring an umbrella so the loaner came in handy; 3) they have a free computer in the lobby that we used to look up movie times at a nearby movie theater; 4) they have themed "carts" which are complimentary--we used a spa cart that contained a foot spa, handheld massager, CD player with relaxing music, lotions, shampoos, loofah, etc.; 5) the cookies in the lobby during check-in were delicious; 6) the free breakfast is very good for getting tourists through a morning of sightseeing in the area; 7) they provide a map on their card key holder which was very convenient for sightseeing; and 8) we did not use the free shuttle but that is also a nice touch. Regarding the previous comment about the hotel not being near anything, this hotel is a few blocks off busy 45th and a few blocks away from University Avenue. We were able to walk to the UW, several movie theaters and many restaurants. Our room faced Roosevelt Avenue and we were not bothered by street noise (I don't think it is a very busy street). I prefered the location to a hotel such as the Deca because it is a little bit out of the way. After dinner and a movie we walked back to the hotel around 10 p.m. and felt very safe along the way. I will be staying here on my next trip to Seattle and my daughter and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business class stay in University neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: SeeSarahTrek
Reviews.Content: The Watertown is, hands down my favorite places to stay in the U-District. The staff is very friendly and the hotel is well kept. The hotel and rooms have a modern aquatic theme with bright clean bathrooms, comfortable queen beds, ample closet space and gorgeous views of downtown Seattle. The rooms also come with complimentary Aveda products, fluffy bathrobes and free parking. The Watertown also has a small workout room to squeeze in your morning run on a rainy day as well as business meeting rooms for your convenience.  The thing I really like is that they actually put time and quality into their continental breakfast. Last we were up they served sausage and eggs, a variety of cereals, soy milks, juices, bagels, smaller sized pastries, granola, fruit and very delicious organic Greek yogurt. The coffee and tea flow all hours and in the evenings they have fresh baked cookies and complimentary wine/beer bar. Really, The Watertown has everything in one place.  They also have two sister hotels; the University Inn just a block away and the Maxwell that just opened in Belltown.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find in Seattle. Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Hisashiburi
Reviews.Content: Very chic, comfortable and in a great location. Wonderful quality of rooms with big flat screens, big closet space, very clean, amenities like bath robes and quality coffee all the time, great free buffet for breakfast. Parking garage underneath is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the university district”
Reviews.Author: mojave_ben
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights on business. I had a top floor room on the back side. I could see Mt. Rainier out my window and avoided being on the possibly noisy street side. Room furnishings were fine; microwave and fridge were nice additions. The hotel is rather trendy decor and feels pretty new. Bed was great and I slept well. The free breakfast was on the basic side but did include eggs and meat each day, also cooked oatmeal, toaster with various breads and bagels - not fancy but quite adequate. I liked that the room key card folder includes a little fold out map of the area - a nice touch. Staff were helpful and pleasant. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back here...”
Reviews.Author: kag10
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Seattle to visit our son & we have stayed at the Watertown Hotel on each occasion & haven't regretted it. This is a great spot, large clean rooms, friendly staff, good location. I love the U district, very unique mix of people, shopping & restaurants - you have to try Thai Tom for the best Thai ever! We havent used the shuttle service to get downtown, the bus system in Seattle is very efficient & you get the experience of mixing with the locals. The store across the road is useful for the odd bottle of wine (or 2!) as needed. I'm sure we will be back here again - hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location and modern decor”
Reviews.Author: melia57
Reviews.Content: A colleague recommended this hotel to me and I was very pleased with my stay. The hotel was nicely decorated and the furniture was very modern. The room was surprisingly bigger than I expected. Good location in the University District. Near Portage Bay Cafe which has great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “So Glad I picked this one!”
Reviews.Author: nikevr
Reviews.Content: just came back from a 7 day stay vacation in seattle. First time in seattle so I was worried about the location, but it was the best choice I could have made. Pro's: 1. location not a problem because of the free shuttle service. Trudy and Ty were awesome, great people and great advice for the first time tourists. Thanks Trudy and Ty, you made our stay really hassle free and super easy. The great thing is that they have several places to drop you off and you can take an easy walk to most of the touristy stuff. (plus taxis from one end of downtown to the other is around 8 bucks). And you can just arrange for pick-up after you're done. 2. free breakfast, scrambled eggs and a protein (bacon, sausage); yogurt, cereals, granola, free tea and coffee 24/7, breads, muffins, etc. 3. Great value, definitely not as expensive as the downtown hotels 4. Rooms are huge. We stayed in a double queen room on the top floor with a great view of the seattle skyline. 5. and there's a nifty little market across the street for anything you might have forgotten, and i hear the deli sandwiches are good there too. 6. more for the business set (quiet) , but I think families would like this hotel a lot. Con's: 1. nothing really much in the vicinity, just a nice quiet urban neighborhood. 2. I didn't get the really friendly feel you get from the front desk. Some were nice, some just seemed busy and could care less. I did get a lot of help from a few of the girls who were really understanding whenever I changed the shuttle schedule around. And the guy who was so patient giving me driving directions over the phone, thanks! My tip: make sure you plan out you're trip...the concierge service is pretty "do it yourself" ^^ 3. Gym is small, but does it's job. gotta wait tho since there's only 4 cardio machines. All in all though, it was the best stay I could have picked. definitely the right choice. price was pretty good too. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: We visit relatives in Seattle often and this is our favorite place to stay. Check in is quick and easy and includes complimentary cookies. The room is the best- uncluttered and minimalist but very comfortable. Sparkling clean and great design. Large bathroom with lots of counter space. Unique urban hotel at very reasonable prices. Includes a nice breakfast with all the usual items plus eggs. Coffe and tea available 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Near the University - New, Clean, Lots of Free Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: canuckinmemphis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the July 4th weekend and had a fantastic time. We were looking for a hotel that was in a relatively convenient location without having to pay for every little extra thing. I couldn't find anywhere that beat the value of this place! Free parking, internet, breakfast, and, get this, bike rentals! The bikes were in decent shape, and locks and helmets are also included for free. The hotel is really close to an entry point to the Burke-Gilman trail that you can ride all the way to the waterfront downtown. We were looking to explore the city by bike, so this was perfect for us! It is also just a couple of blocks form the university campus, and a big outdoor mall is also within walking distance, as well as lots of places to eat, drink, and be merry! The hotel itself is very new and clean, and the room was spacious and a nice break from the "typical" hotel room layout. The shampoo is Aveda rosemary-mint (yum!), and they even offer free "game carts" - you can get free board games, etc delivered to your room (we didn't try this service). Definitely we will stay here next time we are back in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable new hotel very convenient to UW”
Reviews.Author: plant_a_tree_now
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel, with comfortable, well apointed rooms, free wireless, free local calls, free breakfast and helpful staff. There is some noise from the street even in the back (cars, buses, people talking), which is not effectively blocked by the windows. The free breakfast is OK, but oatmeal, other than the instant kind, could be served, improving the health profile of the breakfast. The price is very fair for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: wairRwe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great staff. Great location to the University of WA and right up the street from the Portage Bay Restaurant which does a fabulous breakfast trade; Trinity Market is across the street and the wine is very affordable. Manager could not have been more hospitable. Staff very friendly. Hotel nice and clean. Would definitely stay here again and again. Must admit I had read a couple of reviews and worried about the area -- definitely NOT SO! This is a great place and within walking distance to the campus or the stadium (they also have a shuttle bus) for football games. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: mountaingeek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown Hotel before we did the Seattle-to-Portland Bike Classic. It was very close to the starting line which is why we selected it. However, next time I come to Seattle for a visit of any sort, I'll be sure to stay here. Very close to the University of Washington campus; plus the bus system in Seattle makes a trip downtown a breeze. Very stylish with a great free breakfast. The rooms are breezy & open. Really loved it. The staff as was also great & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Nik021
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Watertown for a week during a conference and loved it. Spacious room (mine was 502) with GREAT views of Seattle cityscape and Mt Rainier. VERY comfortable beds and pillows, quiet at night, coffee maker, fridge, good WiFi, hot breakfast included... nice walk to University of Washington and University Ave (restaurants). Perfect for my needs, and Service was excelletnt

Reviews.Title: “Watertown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: burhead
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to tell all. My husband and I stayed at the Watertown in North Seattle last week for two nights. It was wonderful. It's in a great location and offers nice amenites. I used the comfy robes that were provided and all the delicious bath products by Aveda. One afternoon my husband borrowed one of the hotel's loaner bikes and rode the Burke-Gilman Trail. He enjoyed it and I was happy. While he biked the trail, I walked and shopped on nearby University St. He rode to Ballard, through the Univ of Washington campus and then around Lake Washington. He got some awesome photos! We didn't get to see the Troll under the Fremont bridge but we explored other things in the area....the Locks & the fish ladder (viewing windows) in Ballard, ate at Ivar's on the bayfront. The Watertown was really nice! We ordered the complementary Spa cart. Many different carts to choose from ranging from Kid's Art carts to computer carts, music lovers, etc. We just called the front desk and the wheeled it right up. The breakfast was ok....mainly a continental with warm eggs & bacon or sausage. The hotel offered shuttles to various locations, however we didn't use this service as we had a rental car. Parking was free at Watertown. I'd go back and take my daughters and stay here. Loved it, loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good University Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler CT
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel because we needed parking and a good location. The hotel is modern, good size rooms, ok breakfast, convenient to the highway and university. Actually, if you need a car in Seattle it works out well, close to the Needle where you can park for the day and either walk or take the monorail to downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: JB93110
Reviews.Content: Love the clean, hip, green vibe of this hotel! Beautiful, spacious, very clean room with microwave, fridge, coffeemaker, robes, comfy bed, free underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home at UW in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: amerdansk_dh
Reviews.Content: Watertown is a very cozy and comfortable home away from home. The rooms are very clean and the beds are firm and comfortable. The staff is extremely nice and helpful and hot cookies in the afternoon and a solid breakfast buffet always a welcome treat. Location near UW is great for visiting campus for our new Husky son! We have stayed here twice and will definitely be back again! We used the free rental bikes to tour campus and surrounding area -- a very nice amenity offered. The hotel also has various freebies to borrow while you are there (games, movies, etc). Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The Watered-Down Hotel”
Reviews.Author: willie90212
Reviews.Content: This is truly a “no frills” experience. The “Watered Down Hotel” has no room service, no bellman (carry your own luggage) and young, inexperienced front desk workers. We stayed there four nights, and asked (thrice) the housekeeper and the front desk to change our sheets before giving up. A FedEx package for me was delivered to the Front Desk, and they didn’t notify me and even denied that they’d received it even after I pointed it out sitting on the counter. The fitness center is tiny, obviously an afterthought. On the plus side, the included breakfast buffet was nice, free internet is helpful and the proximity to the U. of W. is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A very good boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBosworth
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Watertown in June 2010 for a one week stay. Once again it did not disappoint . Our suite was good value compared to downtown, and was spacious. It was clean and comfortable , and although there was some traffic noise this dropped off a lot from around 10.00pm until around 7.30 ,so we slept ok. Housekeeping were unobtrusive and very efficient. Front of house were relaxed and helpful, especially when we had to return for one night having missed our flight home. The free Breakfast was more than adequate with fresh pastries and fruit every day. If you also consider the free shuttle downtown and free parking its a bargain. You could argue that the trip into town is inconvenient but you have the benefit of being 5 minutes walk from the University campus grounds - a great place to wander round and relax. Its not a luxury full service hotel but those places tend to be stuffy and we prefer the informaltiy of the Watertown.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: sloopiek
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Watertown while visiting my daughter, a UW freshman, and could not have been more favorably impressed. As busy as this hotel was, they somehow kept delivering little extras that made me feel like a special guest. I used the towncar service to run a couple of errands downtown, so I didn't really need the rental car that I had; it sat in the garage (free parking!). Everything in the UW area is a short walk from the Watertown, and if you opt to take public transportation the bus to downtown stops a half block from the front of the hotel. It is about a 15 min. ride. The desk staff was courteous and helpful. I requested one of the special "carts" (movies) that is a signature of this hotel and it arrived right on time. I The room was large and well laid out. I had a quiet corner room that offered views of the Space Needle and also a bit of a water view. The shower had plenty of pressure and the bed was very comfortable. And the room was absolutely spotless. I could not ask for more. I also availed myself of the very generous complimentary breakfast each morning, and there is a wine tasting in the afternoons (I didn't partake). I used the loaner bicycles to get around the campus and U District, and tried out a few bike trails while my daughter was in class. When you add in all the extras that come with the basic room charge, this hotel is an excellent bargain. And it is a GREAT hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this place”
Reviews.Author: mamatravels18
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel four months in advance over the phone and were told there were rooms available. We were supposed to receive a conformation email which never arrived. We called to find out what was going on and and they lost our booking. They re-booked us and told us everything is okay. We called again to double check a month before because a friend of ours who was staying there had to be moved to another hotel because of a booking problem. They told us our booking was confirmed. A day before we were set to arrive we called to confirm again and they said they had over booked the hotel and that we had to stay at another hotel. This is incredibly annoying considering a lot of time went into deciding which hotel to stay at. Four months ago we would have had our pick of hotels and a day before we were set to leave there was nothing in the area. We had no choice but to go with this alternate hotel. Also, no one had called us up until this point to tell us they changed our location. We would have arrived after a long flight only be told that we were being sent to another location. Serious improvements need to be made to their booking system before anyone considers this place.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: BuccaneerDave
Reviews.Content: An awesome property! Rooms are first rate: spotless, well-designed and comfortable. Lots of great touchs. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is excellent. Free parking. Free shuttle to downtown. Our hotel of choice in Seattle! Try Village Sushi near 50th; outstanding sushi restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel thats well located for UW-S”
Reviews.Author: acl1495 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel indeed - clean and tidy inside, rooms great with good amenities. Made a nice change to not be in a indentikit Holiday Inn/ Marriott chain hotel. Quiet in the room and slept very well. Breakfast could have been a little more inspiring but thats nit-picking. Overall very good value indeed and a really good base if visiting or working at the University.

Reviews.Title: “Great....just do it!”
Reviews.Author: ken_654
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Rooms are contemporary and clean. Fridge and coffee maker in mini-suite (regular room). Comfortable bed and pillows. Good location. They have free bikes to borrow and ride around town....a very nice touch. In three days there on business I took a bike out four or five times. There is the awesome bike trail (Burke-Gilman?) a few blocks away which is perfect. Service was friendly and helpful. Even have a PC in the lobby for you to print your boarding pass. Breakfast buffet is better than usual. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hoprrible Hotel - and I was attacked by a homeless person”
Reviews.Author: travel_a_lot_20100
Reviews.Content: This poorly lit hotel is in an awful neighborhood (more about that later). My room was very noisy, even on the top floor - hotel is on a really busy street. The bedspread was filthy. The carpet was stained - this hotel needs maintenance. The staff is surly. And - on a Sunday morning at 10 am - I was hit by a homeless person, while walking 20 feet from the hotel. So if you want a noisy, dirty, and unsafe hotel, with staff that doesn't care, that's Watertown Hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Retreat from the Rain”
Reviews.Author: SKLN
Reviews.Content: My daughter stayed at the Watertown while visiting the University of Washington, which is only 4 blocks away from the hotel. The hotel is wonderful and the staff just awesome! We did encounter a noise problem in our first room which faced the main street. The street noise outside kept me awake and so I changed to a quieter room. The quieter room, however, was smaller than my first room. In the future, I will request a corner room in the back of the hotel, so as to get the large room and a quiet location. The other problem I had was that there was no inexpenisive transport to or from the airport. I believe this will no longer be a problem in the near future, since the subway will run from downtown to the airport, and the Watertown's shuttle takes guests downtown. Back to the positive points -- the delicious cookies at 3 pm every afternoon, 24/7 tea coffee & cocoa available, spa cart with foot bath, comfy bed, good breakfast, smiling and helpful employees, and computer with printer available in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: eric1032
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. It's on a nice and semi-quiet street near the university and you can see students biking their way to school. The room is spacious and exceptionally clean. The staff is very friendly. The complimentry breakfast is above aveage. The hotel provides free shuttle service to and from downtown Seattle. I took the adventurous route coming back from downtown and hopped on a Seattle metro bus, which was fun. Lastly the price is very reasonable for these type of hotel, i felt money well spent. Definitely staying here if I ever visit seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle to area attractions makes staying here convenient”
Reviews.Author: overthehill79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the UW neighborhood for two nights while our hardwood floors at home were being refinished. We chose the hotel because we wanted to be in Seattle but didn't want the expense of downtown parking. The free hotel shuttle made that possible as we wanted to go downtown to see the ginger bread houses at the Sheraton, the Teddy Bear room at the Four Seasons, the carousel at Westlake Center and walk Pike Place Market stalls. Enjoyed lunch at Kell's Irish Pub, too. Underground parking was convenient and secure, requiring our room key to access. The room was well laid out including a TV that could be rotated from the bedroom to the bathroom/dressing area. The closets opened both to the bedroom and the bath. This is the only hotel we've stayed in where a achohol wipe was placed under the phone and by the TV remote for use by the guest to clean each item. Nice touch. Lighting in the room is inadequate as the hotel uses CFLs that do not provide adequate light, especially at the desk. We used the free wireless internet as we had our laptop with us. Morning continental breakfast was adequate but not overwhelming. Eggs were cold, sausage warm. Didn't use the exercise room but it appeared to hacve three or four machines and maybe six or seven bikes on a rack on the wall, those available to guests for use. During the Summer when the weather is nice, the availability of bikes is a good deal given the fact that the Burke-Gilman bike trail is about five blocks away. Staff very friendly and helpful with suggestions and directions. Would stay here again should the need arise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Bertini
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad we found this hotel. The location is great, the rooms are large and very clean. Breakfast was very good and the chocolate chip cookies were yummy. The shuttle service was very convenient and bus service just one block away. If you want to treat yourself to an amazing dinner go to Avila 1 mile down 45th Ave. The shuttle will take you there. It's not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Furls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October - what a find. Very reasonably priced accommodation with comfortable rooms, safe and free underground parking with a complimentary shuttle into Seattle centre. The excellent breakfast was buffet style - perfect for our needs. Homemade cookies in the afternoon and complimentary coffee/microwave popcorn in the room. A super stay and we'll definitely be back again if ever in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: DarkCrystal
Reviews.Content: We're already planning our return visit to this hotel. They really thought of everything to make your stay the best - starting from the mouthwatering aroma of the cookies at the front desk to the comfortable beds at night. Staff was exceptional! We didn't try the `al la cartes` but what a great idea. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Congratulations to the staff on making this a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LOB16
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location to the university (a couple blocks away) and customer reviews. A hip hotel with large windows and good amenities. LOVED the ala CARTS- specialty carts that are free and available upon request- I got the spa cart and loved it. It came with a good selection of relaxing CDs and player, massage foot bath and wand, teas and lotion. This is a very creative and wonderful idea by this hotel- some carts included "Mom, Im bored" cart, surfing the internet cart, game cart, etc. Free wireless in rooms, comfy beds and free breakfast. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Spacious, Upscale and Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiBoogieman
Reviews.Content: Large rooms and activity cart for the kids made for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Bullit_9
Reviews.Content: Very nice , clean , good price for all that you get . Shuttle which is free was the BEST I have ever used . Outstanding Crew !! Excellent Hot Breakfast . Mouth watering cookies ( As in homemade ) every day @ 3 PM . This is simply put , " The best Place I have ever stayed " I will come again !!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: ninapod
Reviews.Content: A favorite. Design is modern and clean, and rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Easy highway access and central location was perfect for work. Neighborhood is a slightly grungy college town but you'd never know from the impeccable rooms and professional service. Secure parking. Love the Aveda products and nice breakfast, and a view of downtown from my room. Excellent value, a step above your typical business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will always think of Watertown first!”
Reviews.Author: Dalaguete
Reviews.Content: I'm checking out tomorrow morning, and yet couldn't wait to submit my glowing review of this immaculate and well-located hotel. As if the free breakfast, internet and parking were not enough, the staff is beyond thoughtful and go the extra mile; the furnishings are modern and comfortable. Watertown delivers everything it promises!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: coot
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 month old daughter and I spent two wonderful nights at the Watertown Hotel. We found our room exceptionally clean, modern, quiet and comfortable. Having a microwave and fridge in the room was useful and helpful. Our daughter loved sitting on the edge of one of the (almost) floor to ceiling windows. The location was a great point from which to do our sightseeing even despite my foibles as navigator. We loved the little things like free parking, free internet access, and free daily paper delivered to our door. Free laundry facilities are also available. We took advantage of the complimentary breakfast buffet (certainly adequate) which had something for everyone and included fresh fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, English muffins, baked goods, cereal, scrambled eggs, sausage/bacon, juice, milk, coffee, and even soy milk! We were amazed with the quality and service of the hotel for its price point and would stay here again. PS Funnily, my husband found that the jazz music piping out of speakers near the elevators in the underground parking lot reminded him of Frasier!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant and friendly place.”
Reviews.Author: artnipples
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here with our two kids (ages 9 & 12) in August. The staff were all very friendly & helpful, the hotel was clean and well-managed, the free underground parking was a bonus. There were lots of nice touches - the free chocolate chip cookies put out each day at the front desk, the Google maps staff kindly printed out whenever we asked for directions, the filtered water in the rooms. The breakfast was nothing fancy but certainly enjoyable - scrambled eggs, sausage (your basic pork variety), yogurt, fresh fruit (bananas, melons, oranges), juice, coffee, cereal, baked goods (rthese could be better but were ok if you toasted them), jam, peanut butter, etc. We all ate as much as we wanted and were quite sated. I would definitely stay at the Watertown again and I would highly recommend it to others. If you're looking for nightlife it's a little off the beaten track and you'd be better off downtown. If you're more interested in sightseeing during the day, it's very well situated and a breeze to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Finding”
Reviews.Author: lvpool
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 3.5 miles outside the downtown. It is very close to UW, so if you are visiting UW, this will be an excellent location. If you are visiting the Seattle area for the first time, like we were, I would highly recommend getting used to the public transportation system. I think it can be very useful, but for us very confusing. We ended up driving to everywhere. Parking is so expensive in Seattle and I was very happy to find a hotel which does not charge $20/day just for parking. Be aware of this parking fee when you are making a reservation for your hotel. Watertown has a free parking, so it is a big plus. Breakfast was pretty good. Staffs were accommodating and friendly. Room was clean, but not spacious. Since the closet is in the middle of the room, I think it felt smaller than it actually is. Both my wife and I felt that the bed was a little bit uncomfortable, but my kids were not complaining. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: TariTari
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, new, and fresh feeling. Check in was quick, parking easy and free, in-room coffee very good, and breakfast was very nice (it stayed open until 10am on a weekday, which is rare). The room lay out and furnishing were very nice. It was nice to have an electrical outlet for my laptop situated at the desk - handy little thing that lots of hotels don't think of. We asked about being shuttled to somewhere they usually don't shuttle and they said they could do it for us; although we ended up not taking them up on the offer, it was impressive of them to make the effort to accomodate us.

Reviews.Title: “A+ University Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mh999
Reviews.Content: For five nights this hotel rolled out what felt like red carpet treatment while we prepared to leave our daughter at University of Washington to start her freshman year. The front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful (especially Jessica); there is a 24 hour coffee/tea service (loved this!!!); they allowed shipping and storage of two large boxes of dorm stuff; the room was spacious, clean and very comfortable (love it when hotels have pretty, washable duvet covers); there is "green" conscientiousness everywhere.
