Something unique here is their "cart" system---they have all these in-room entertainment carts that you reserve or check out---computer, games, spa, etc. This is one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had anywhere in the world, even with the drama of leaving a child in a far-from-home city! I will want to stay at the Watertown over the course of the next 4 years, so I hope there will always be room at the inn when I'm in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 nights at Watertown”
Reviews.Author: robyn14
Reviews.Content: We visited Seattle with our two children, ages 7 and 10, and the Watertown was a great and memorable place to stay. The hotel was clean, well-kept, a great location for getting in and out of the city, with lots of nice amenities. As noted by others, parking is free, internet is free, even the laundry is free! The room uses its space creatively-- the four of us did not feel cramped, despite it being a somewhat small room. Our safe wasn't working when we arrived but was fixed once we notified the front desk. My children really enjoyed the board game cart (Monopoly, Sorry, Clue, Candy Land, etc...). One afternoon we walked about three blocks to Trader Joes to pick up some healthy mid-day snacks (the room has a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker). We used the free shuttle one day into town, but drove the other days. And all this for a very wallet-friendly price of about $130. We briefly considered staying downtown for around twice the price-- we're so glad we stayed at the Watertown! If we returned to Seattle, we would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - free parking and close to UW”
Reviews.Author: Cattledogs
Reviews.Content: We wanted to drive Steven's Pass to do some hiking, so we moved from a hotel in the town to Watertown as the parking was free and it was close to the UW campus. We could check in early and the room was big and very nice. Bathroom was hugeand clearn but it did not have any windows and it was dimmly lighted. There was the construction going across the street from early in the morning so we really could not keep the window open. Beds were comfortable and the over all the room was great with a little fridge and microwave (I think). There were many restraunts around being near the campus. Breakfast was great! There were nice front desk people, and there was a rude one. But overall, this is the great hotel if you want to enjoy outside the town - nice room and breakfast. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: Hike_bike_and_like
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel twice in July, first for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and on the last night of our West Coast trip, which was about a week after our initial stay. We really enjoyed the Watertown Hotel! It is located north of downtown Seattle and I called the hotel ahead of time to ask about transportation from the airport. They arranged for us to be picked up by car service, and the driver was early and contacted me by cellphone. The car service far exceeded expectations -- we were picked up in a super clean, comfortable, Cadillac SUV with leather interior; the driver was very friendly and capable, and we did not have to wait (he waited for us!). At the hotel, we used the free shuttle service to go downtown on our second day. After that, we rented a car and took advantage of the hotel's free and secure parking garage. We appreciated the neighborhood and walked around a good bit, strolling through the Univ of Wash campus (about 1/4 mile away) and down to Portage Bay. We also shopped at Trader Joe's (2 blocks away) for some easy, fresh takeout to eat in the room. Our first room was average sized, but the vanity area was very large and the room had several nice features. There was a microwave and mini fridge and very nice and spacious custom cabinetry. The bath products are by Aveda, which is a nice touch. We found the bed and pillows to be quite comfortable and everything was very clean. At night, the street outside was quiet and we heard no other noises. During the day, the street was busier, but the noise was not a problem at all. We took advantage of the quick and easy free wireless internet using our iphone and our ipod touch. We also found the staff to be very helpful in recommending walks and places to eat. Our second room was a suite (don't know why they gave us that) and it was HUGE. It was L-shaped with a large spa tub under a window in one corner, and it had a couch, coffee table, and armchair as well as a desk. The vanity area was even bigger than in our first room, and it had the same pretty cabinetry and amenities. Unfortunately, and possibly because of the record heat in Seattle, our second room was not adequately cooled. The a/c worked but was too small for a huge 6th floor room. We tried the free breakfast a few times. It was typical free breakfast fare (cereal, oatmeal, toast, store-bought bagels, juice, milk, etc) with the addition of fresh scrambled eggs (which were fine) and bacon or sausage (which we didn't try). They also had lots of bananas and small cups of yogurt, too. It was nice to have fresh coffee and free breakfast. We highly recommend this hotel and chose to stay there on our last night, even though we had to drive a little further to get there from Portland than we would have had we stayed near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “We love the shuttle service and breakfirst.”
Reviews.Author: pinkfrogsea
Reviews.Content: The shuttle service was so good for us. The free breakfirst is great! Very clean room!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with free transfer downtown. Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: StanleySurreyUK
Reviews.Content: We did not want to pay the high downtown prices, yet have a quiet and comfortable stay and Watertown fitted the bill. The free transfer downtown is a definate plus point and the rooms are spacious and suit families. Staff are helpful with a excellent local knowledge. The Breakfast is good but there are not enough tables if the Hotel is full.

Reviews.Title: “Stay At This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: prairie_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, and were impressed from start to finish. The rooms were super clean (even in corners and places not reached w/a routine vacuuming), & the decor was lovely. I'm going to call the hotel and see if I can find out where to get their pillows, we loved them. They have a fun "cart" system where you can ask for an art cart or a games cart or a grumpy cart etc. The free breakfasts were very nice - juice, fresh cooked eggs and sausage, range of cereals, yogurts, bagels, donuts, fresh fruit, good coffee. Parking garage spaces were a little small, if you're renting a car I'd suggest going with a smaller one, we had a Chrysler 300 and it was a challenge some nights. Hotel is located very near a freeway on-ramp, and super close to the University. Takes about 20 minutes in traffic to get downtown, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lookingforlunch
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the hotel. Rooms were sunny, large, clean. Chocolate chip cookies at reception on arrival. Gated free parking garage under the hotel, free continental breakfast (including scrambled eggs and sausage or bacon), free wireless. We were worried when we got to our rooms to find that it was right next to the elevator, fearing that we would hear people in the halls and the ding of the elevator all night. But once we were in the room, we never heard a thing. Had a room overlooking that parking lot, but that certainly didn't bother me. Just lift your head up and look at the horizon instead of looking down at ... a parking lot. Hotel is just a few blocks from UW, and I wouldn't consider it sketchy. But you do have to walk a couple of blocks to get to the main shopping/restaurant streets around campus. Overall very pleased with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Easily one of the best hotel experiences I've had!”
Reviews.Author: popflower
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I listened to TripAdvisor reviewers and booked this hotel! The staff was very helpful and friendly, the room was large and clean, and we loved the complimentary shuttle to downtown. We will definitely be staying here again when we return to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: salsrug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of our trip to Seattle and loved it. Initially they gave us a room with two queen beds but when we went down and asked for a King they quickly upgraded us to a suite which was excellent. The price was great for the area. The bed was fantastic and the free parking rocks. The staff was knowledgable about the area and gave us a great recommendation for dinner. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Imsonotkidding
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night at the hotel and were thoroughly impressed with every detail. So close to downtown Seattle and located in the U district it is convenient to everything downtown. Parking is complimentary and the service was outstanding! This hotel was a recommendation per the booking agent based on the excellent customer satisfaction rating when my first choice was booked. This hotel will now be my first choice everytime I return to Seattle. The rate was unbelievable, the rooms while in the heart of activity were pin-drop quiet, and the design and layout were modern and high quality. We were amazed at the size of our standard room - very luxurious and spacious. I am an infinite critic and to be this pleased with our experience is very rare. They get my highest rating!

Reviews.Title: “Help yourself, do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: promonadeneighbor
Reviews.Content: I can not believe this is the hotel with such high review rating in tripadvisor.com. We usually follow the review rating in tripadvisor.com and always find great hotel. But this time, it's not the case at all. The front desk staff were two young ladies who obviously have some princess complex. They simply stare at us without a word upon our arrival. By the way, we are just normal people dressed properly with no strange behavior or smell and were very polite. We had to greet them first to check in. Every time we ask any question in the front desk, there was only cold response and no smile at all. The shuttle is only run once every hour. We had to take a taxi to downtown Seattle even though the shuttle was parked right outside the hotel. The room is very very small, not to mention the bathroom, the bathmat has yellow urine dried on it and the shower curtain is smelly. Don't expect to get a room like the one you see in their website, it's just plain and small. We stayed at a Sheraton in LA for a cheaper price before coming here, and it was like falling from heaven to hell. The free internet they provided only work with ethernet connection, we have to sit in front of the tiny desk in our hotel roomif we want to go online. The wireless connection is so weak, it takes 5 minutes to open my email inbox in yahoo. We visited Seattle few years ago, and stayed in an hotel downtown. Couldn't remember the name but it was the normal hotel experience with friendly staff greeting us. Watertown hotel is not welcoming at all. This feel like an university student housing. What am awful experience! Help yourself, avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “stop looking, this is where you should stay”
Reviews.Author: jstef1182
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that the Watertown in Seattle is a great find and can't wait to return 1st: Breakfast is wonderful and complimentary not just the regular bagel and coffee they have eggs great selection of juices and bacon plus a lot more 2nd The room big, clean, modern, with some nice views, plus some extra features like there cart services 3rd The price and the customer service in my opinion cannot be beat the beautiful ladies there were fast, courteous, and seemed to really care that you are there try finding that a holiday inn or red roof inn 4th the shuttle is a wonderful service free but you should tip the guy takes you write to the space nettle and a couple of blokes from pikes place what more do you want

Reviews.Title: “It's the best!”
Reviews.Author: familyevents
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Watertown when visiting relatives in the University of Washington area of Seattle for the highest quality at the most reasonable price. The staff is exceptionally friendly, professional and helpful - you truly feel that they care. The amenities and extras are amazing: I always borrow one of the computer carts, so I can access my email, etc.; there are bicycles available for a ride along the lake; the hot breakfast is perfect and there is always a fresh apple or cookie on the way in/out... and the rooms are both sophisticated and comfortable. Quite simply, it is the best!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced minimalist hotel”
Reviews.Author: C_12349
Reviews.Content: If you like 50's era danish modern minimalist furniture, stained carpets, bathroom tiles with a color pattern that makes them look dirty (so you can't tell if they are) concrete walled lobby, security that's real pain, finally great view of mountains as you look over tar roofed shabby nearby buildings, and finally well overpriced compared to hotels to the north and east of the University Campus, then by all means stay here. I reserved a room based as the hotel was on the University list. It was the highest priced and so I thought would be the nicest. The room was $179 + Tax. My reservation was for 5 days. I moved out after the first day to a NICER room at $129 about a mile away. Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, fresh cookies!”
Reviews.Author: likeslocalstuff
Reviews.Content: Urban, new decor with many amenities including Aveda products, hard and soft pillows of your choice, windows that open, bathrobes, baked cookies, quiet. The parking is free and very secure as well as the elevators to your rooms because you need to have your pass key to get to your floor. Breakfast complimentary and choices may include scrambled eggs as well as the usuals. Next time we stay in Seattle we will either stay here or the University Inn hotel right next door. The University Inn allows Watertown Hotel the use of their pool also! The location is not too far away from the main hubub of the city and enough away you are not feeling rushed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does it right!”
Reviews.Author: FlygirlDallas
Reviews.Content: It has been a long time since I have walked away from a hotel and said, Wow! The location was great next to the university, close to water and downtown. Modern, very clean property. Rooms very comfortable with many nice touches. Love the refrigerator and microwave in room. Breakfast and PARKING included, the garage was secure, which was nice since we left some of our climbing gear in the car. The staff could not have been nicer. We enjoyed the bikes that were available for no charge and rode the Burke Gilman trail that was a short distance away. I will stay here again next time I'm in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Urban Condo-like Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittypie45
Reviews.Content: Received good service at front desk. Hotel room had all the amenities we were looking for- small fridge, microwave, free wifi, hairdryer/huge mirror, window you could open, air conditioning, and robes. When we pulled into the hotel to check-in, we didn't know where to park the car until we saw they had an underground garage that was gated. Front desk beeped us in. This actually made the hotel feel more like an urban condominium/residency, not a big chain, all-the-same hotel. They offered a courtesy shuttle to Downtown/Space Needle, but we didn't use the service. We had a rental car and was able to easily drive and park at the Pacific Science Center/Space Needle, taking the monorail to Downtown/Pike Place to walk around, able to do all in 1 day. Hotel is in the University District (~10mins from Downtown), so it's more urban/suburb-like w/lots of college students, but is cheaper and has all amentities and more than the expensive hotels in Downtown Seattle. About 5-8 mins away from hotel is a 24hr QFC grocery store, drug store, and other shopping; take a car/bike (hotel offers rentals) to get there, too far to walk. LEAST favorite part of our stay was the water pressure in the sink and toilet, it was pretty weak and minimal water came out of the faucet. BEST part of our stay was actually the continental breakfast that had LOTS of substance-- muffins, danishes, sausage or bacon, scrambled eggs, toast, yogart/fruit, orange juice/coffee, cereal, oatmeal, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not available...on wedding night?!”
Reviews.Author: Coffee185
Reviews.Content: I read wonderful things about this hotel on TripAdvisor, and decided that I would stay here for my wedding night before my honeymoon. I reserved a room months ahead of time, pre-paid for it, and after a long wedding day (5am to 2am), went with my new bride to our well-deserved rest. However, I was stunned to arrive in the middle of the night and find that the manager had given our room away. We had ALREADY paid, and NO rooms were available. Their policy, so they said, was to put us up in the University Inn for the night -- definitely NOT what we wanted, nor what we paid for. The employee was completely useless in finding us an alternative hotel in Seattle. He said that everything was full, and that he was very sorry. The unwritten policy was to pay for our room at another hotel, but of course, he couldn't find one. I asked to speak with a manager. No manager available that Sunday morning. I asked for a computer, and found a room at the Redmond Marriott (decent) in 3 minutes. We stormed out, exhausted and frustrated. The next morning, of course, the manager did not call me. I wasn't called on Monday either. Attempts to reach the hotel by phone only reached their fax machine. I left on my honeymoon, and two weeks later, found a message from the manager on my phone sometime during my trip. The hotel refunded our money, but no comment on what had happened, what they would do to satisfy us, and definitely no comment on their "unwritten policy." I've travelled around the country, and never would have thought that my worst experience would be in my home city, and at its top hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You are missing out if you don't stay at the Watertown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gotoH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Watertown Seattle. It was our first time at hotel and Seattle. Modern decor which we loved, the room was perfect with attention to detail. I loved the small round nautical frosted window in bathroom door. It was a wonderful stay, staff friendly appreciated the wine, snacks in evening, coffee available, shuttle to main attractions and great restaurant within walking distance. It is our favorite hotel & wish they had them all over the country.

Reviews.Title: “Style, Convenience, and Value”
Reviews.Author: StephanieFitz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Watertown for two days of sightseeing, and we loved it! As mentioned by others, in addition to the spacious simple rooms and excellent staff, there are tons of freebies, and we managed to take advantage of many, including free self-service laundry, great high-speed wi-fi, the breakfast (and we went down late and there was still great selection of items), free all-day coffee, free garage parking, and the shuttle into town to see the sights. The location of the hotel is really the only minus (it's near the university, about 4 miles from where the main sights are), BUT the hotel's shuttle solved that problem for us. At the end of a long day of sightseeing, we were able to call from downtown and request a pickup on the fly and get back to our hotel in a quick 10-minute ride. The university neighborhood is also fun, full of little quirky shops, restaurants, and coffee shops. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to almost anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Spectreben
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive reviews I read. Free internet, breakfast, indoor car parking, and bike rentals made this a terrific bargain. Ask for a room on the 4th floor with a view of downtown - it's spectacular. This place is spotless, and the front desk staff couldn't be nicer and more helpful. One warning - get down to breakfast before 8:00 am - otherwise it's very crowded and there are lines for the one toaster, bacon/sausage runs out, etc. But this is a minor inconvenience for an otherwise terrific hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easy On The Family Budget”
Reviews.Author: luckynumber4
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and I and 2 sons ages 15 and 24) were in Seattle overnight to catch a Mariners game. While searching for a reasonably priced hotel on the internet I came across a link for the website "ballgametravel.com". Through this website I booked the Watertown Hotel at $50 USD off the listed rate on the hotels website for a room with 2 queen beds. Very clean, modern hotel. Free secure parking and complimentary breakfast and not just a continental breakfast. They offered the standard coffee, tea, juices, milk, and also had scrambled eggs, bacon, cereals, bagels, toast, pastries. For my family of 4, between the free parking and free breakfast we probably saved $80 to $100 by choosing this hotel just on those two things alone. We paid $129 USD for the hotel room, plus taxes, a far cry what they were asking for hotel rooms downtown, if you could find one! It was just off the I-5, easy to find and easy and quick to get back to the hotel after the ballgame. We didn't take advantage of alot of the other services the hotel offers like the a la cartes, free shuttles to various locations, gym and access to a neighboring hotels pool and sauna. We liked that the hotel had windows you could open. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, modern rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MarkyRenton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days when moving to the U for college. The place is very peaceful, friendly and has great breakfast. They make things easy. This is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jade_w21
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I just returned from our stay at the Watertown Hotel. We were very happy with our stay there. We stayed in a king studio room. The platform bed was firm, but very comfortable. There was a microwave, mini refrigerator and coffee pot in the room. The bathroom was big along with the vanity area. The housekeeping staff always did a good job of cleaning. We enjoyed the free breakfast in the lobby area every morning. We also appreciated the free parking and shuttle service to downtown. We thought being outside of the downtown area might have been a drawback. However, we enjoyed the university area and enjoyed being away from the hustle and bustle of downtown. Taking the bus downtown was rather easy too. The hotel staff was always very helpful if you needed a question answered. Overall, we were very happy with the Watertown and would definately recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: sharp_squared
Reviews.Content: Use to live in Seattle so location wasn't too important but hotel is central to everything. Rooms were clean although we did request a King and got 2 beds (no biggie), front desk very helpful and free secure parking was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great cookies!”
Reviews.Author: auditna
Reviews.Content: The staff were all helpful. The shuttle was a bonus. The rooms were very comfortable and roomy. Clean. Quiet. The cookies were awesome!!!!!! Our only "problem" was the wireless internet was difficult to startup.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: sgeak
Reviews.Content: Our stay was short but sweet. The service was excellent. The location easy to find. The shuttle service to the UW Medical Center was prompt. The staff was courteous. Accommodations were roomy and beds comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay At the Watertown”
Reviews.Author: RETIREDTRAVELER1200
Reviews.Content: This is the cleanest hotel, friendly staff, complete complimentary breakfast, free parking, perfect beds, great lighting......and order up a "special cart" for even more of a deal. This is our 4th stay at the Hotel, and we have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the U District”
Reviews.Author: BG_Traveler2009
Reviews.Content: We'll stay again. The room was clean and the decor was unique and relaxing. We really appreciated not being "nickel and dimed" to death with fees. The complimentary ala carts are a great idea. With a daughter living in the district we are aware of the crime issues and were grateful for a secure building/parking garage. The only downside that I could find was that we've come to expect LCD or plasma TVs and iPod docks, which Watertown doesn't have, but the ala carts make up for the deficit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel near campus - don't bother going anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: chaneen99
Reviews.Content: The Watertown hotel is a unique hotel near the campus of U of W with many amenities that reminded me of a bed and breakfast. They had free hot breakfast, fresh-baked cookies in the lobby, umbrellas for guests who forgot theirs, and free coffee available all day. The staff was super friendly, respectful, and very helpful. They replaced our bath products daily. We loved it so much that we won't stay anywhere else in Seattle! Just to warn others, the beds are on the firm side, but that is just personal preference anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Watertown!!”
Reviews.Author: okatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown Hotel for a UW football game and it was a great choice. We walked to the game and didn't have to worry about parking. It was a long hike but a stop off in the university district on the way made it fine. I would probably stay Downtown if I didn't have a university event, but for anything related to UW, it is great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ranked #1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: wanda&ted
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Watertown. Everything was the same as the last time... wonderful! The rooms are VERY clean and spacious. Linens are great. Service is great. The breakfast was plentiful and good. Free parking, if you have a car. Although the parking spots can be a bit tight which led to several cars "hanging" over to take up a second parking spot. People... be considerate! I liked how the television could be reversed into the bathroom. Nice feature. Also, the closet was accessible to both the sleeping area and the bathroom. Cool! Maybe the only problem I could find was that the blinds on the window don't give much privacy. I like them open for the light to come in, but the neighbors are a bit too close for complete privacy. The Watertown should know that their staff (especially housekeeping) are great and that they should pay them well! It was a very nice stay. No wonder they rank number #1.

Reviews.Title: “I adore this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tieliot
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Watertown is always one of the highlights of my trips to Seattle. It is truly a home away from home. The room layouts are wonderful and the staff friendly and helpful. The amenities (such as free shuttle to downtown, complimentary breakfast, free bikes, specialty entertainment carts) add to the pleasure. On my most recent visit, we did have a glitch. The room I'd reserved and called the day before to confirm was not available when we arrived apparently because of the late check-out of guests before. The night manager arranged for us to have a complimentary room at the University Inn just a block away. Nice to have one night free but, I would have much rather been in the hotel I love from the very beginning.

Reviews.Title: “You have to try this”
Reviews.Author: Bournemouthlady
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a fabulous hotel. They even write to you if you fill in a comment card to thank you. You have to stay here.Do not hesitate. I could not fault a thing. Now this is really important. You MUST go to the Italian Restaurant Mama Melina just up the road. You MUST try the meatballs and spaghetti and the Risotto. We ate there both nights we were at Watertown. The staff will direct you, no more than 5 minutes walk. Bring expandable trousers and be prepared for a wonderful meal!

Reviews.Title: “Greeted w/ Warm Cookies!”
Reviews.Author: FarAwayStar
Reviews.Content: What can be better than to be greeted w/ a plate of warm cookies? I don't know of much. We arrived shortly after 3pm and were quickly checked into our spacious room. We were headed to Tacoma to go to the Museum of Glass. We told the girl at the front desk, Jessica, on our way up where we wanted to go and by the time we got down, she had a map for us and instructions on how to get there. They have a lovely shuttle service as the hotel is not right downtown. They were very accommodating and were always on time to pick us up. The beds were very comfortable, which is always important. I enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ladybug-cougar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a football game at Husky Stadium last weekend and looked for a hotel close to the University area. The Watertown had good reviews on Tripadvisor so we stayed there and we are glad we did. List to follow: new hotel, nice staff, comfortable bed, spacious and clean room, good breakfast (no charge), Starbucks in the room and at breakfast. This hotel has a free shuttle to the downtown area, space needle, university stadium and university shopping center, which we used everyday. We didn't rent a car. Would always stay here if attending another game.

Reviews.Title: “Watertown Hotel -- A Great Choice For UW and Seattle Area Visit”
Reviews.Author: MyManao
Reviews.Content: My daughter and & stayed here to check her in early to the UW dorms in August '08. We arrived a couple of days ahead in order to tour the university district and Seattle in general. Excellent location relative to UW and nearby university scene was a great plus for our purposes. Excellent location relative to freeway (I-5) ramps and other major roads made outside exploration easy (ample free parking ain't bad either). Very helpful (if young...but weren't we all at one time?) staff tolerated my requests and questions quickly, w/o a hint of annoyance, and always with a smile. Free continental+ breakfast was a nice touch, as were the free bicycles (nice for touring campus). Rooms are sizable, clean, and adequately appointed. It's not the 4-Seasons, nor is it the Plaza, but if you've got a reason to visit UW and/or want to tour around the general Puget Sound area, but don't want to deal with the big hotel scene, I strongly suggest staying at the Watertown. I will be bringing the rest of my family here throughout my daughter's next 4 (I hope) years at UW.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Megs1722
Reviews.Content: Good free breakfast, quiet, awesome big rooms, wonderful free shuttle, safe with key card access in elevator, very helpful staff. I wish they had this hotel in every city I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: pickledust
Reviews.Content: Fabulous staff! Beautiful imaculate rooms and all of the little amenities made it a memoable stay. Watertown has raised my expectations for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is tops!”
Reviews.Author: ParticularPortland
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled for knee replacement surgery on July 28th at the UW Surgical Center. Since we are from Portland, the surgeon stipulated that we would have to remain in the Seattle area for no less than 10 days after the surgery (infection etc.) The Watertown Hotel was listed on the UW Housing options sheet for people needing a place to stay before and after the release from the hospital. After checking it out on the web, I booked a "board room". My wife and I checked in on July 27th and stayed for 10 days, departing on August 6th. With limited mobility due to the operation, I was apprehensive about what would I do during that extended period of time. But, from the moment we checked in, the front desk staff were incredibly welcoming and cordial to a fault. Breakfast was hosted daily as was happy hour and hoer devoires in the evening. The wine, food, and surrounding ambiance was wonderful and the guests that were there during our stay seemed to enjoy the experience every bit as much as we did. Our room (board room) was specious and open. It definitely helped to create a positive feeling, both from the amenities that were included to the views of the outside surroundings and scenery. The staff went overboard in insuring that we were comfortable. Our last night was our anniversary and the staff sent up a superb bottle of wine and also told the GM at Daniels Restaurant to provide us with their exquisite seafood salad combination before our formal dinner. Talk about pleasantly surprised! We're sold and will definitely be back. The Watertown staff conducts itself as if they really care about you and the fact that they go the extra mile seems to be perfectly natural in that setting.

Reviews.Title: “Just try it! You'll love it!”
Reviews.Author: opieluvCA
Reviews.Content: This place is truly amazing! Yes, it is a bit out of the way for the Seattle hot spots in downtown, but that is what makes it extra special. It is really only a 10 minute drive from all the action. From the moment we arrived, the staff was very nice. We came in very late, but our room was ready and it took less than two minutes to check-in. We had a studio suite and it was spacious, spotless and nicely equipped. The king bed was truly comfortable and our kids (5 and 10) stayed on the sofa sleeper and did not complain once. We had a gorgeous view of Mt. Rainier out one side. There is also a microwave with a free popcorn package, a coffee maker, and a little refrigerator in your vanity area. The hotel is VERY secure....front door locked at 10 pm and a room key is needed to access guestroom floors at all times. The FREE parking garage (YES, FREE) is also secured pretty well. The evening beer, wine and soda coupled with veggies and snacks was really nice and the breakfast in the morning was worth its weight in gold! Scrambled eggs, breakfast meat, cereals, yogurt, bagels, muffins, oatmeal, Starbucks coffee and Tazo teas...all made for a great start-up meal. Just remember to GO EARLY. By 9:00 the place was so crowded we were sitting on the couches to eat. Not many tables! We went at 8:15 and it was very nice. The hotel also has a mini general store right in the lobby and their mark-up on items was not bad at all. I think they added about $.85 to a $1.90 quiche from the market up the street. It is a GREAT little store with drinks, snacks, microwaveable meals, etc. We also partook of the FREE washer and dryer on every floor. That was awesome! There isn't all that much around the hotel to walk to with the exception of Mamma Melena's up the street (excellent Italian food in a very relaxed setting with superb service). The neighborhood was a bit scary at first with a few rundown houses and homeless folks, but it wasn't bad at all. There is even a Trader Joe's market nearby and we got some microwaveable stuff for dinner one night and saved a TON of money. We also tried the Portage Cafe down at the Watertown's sister hotel, University Inn, and while the atmosphere was pretty cool, the service was horrible (waitress was rude and apparently at the end of her shift) and the menu was mostly organic/health food so it was "different" from what we are used to. It was not bad at all, but it wasn't all that great and the prices were a bit high, in my opinion, for a college town eatery. My advice, skip it. The staff at the front desk was always gracious and ready to help in anyway they could. We used the complimentary shuttle downtown to pick-up our rental car and the driver was very kind as well. My only complaints: 1) The cart system, while a great idea, was a bust for us. We tried to get the movie cart so we could watch a movie (no DVD players in the rooms) but whoever had the limited number they keep onhand did not return them while we were there so we never got one. They either need to rewrite the policy on the amount of time a cart can be kept by guests or put DVD players in all rooms. We also tried to borrow a movie from the VERY limited DVD collection only to find that the one we wanted and that they thought they had was not in the case and had likely been stolen. Bummer! 2) One elevator of the two was broken during our stay. This made for VERY long waits to move between the 5 guest room floors, the lobby, and the two levels of the parking garage. 3) There are no "bellman" so you do have to move your own luggage. Thankfully, they had two carts sitting by the elevators, but only two. 4) There is no real drop off place in front. It is on a one way street and there is no driveway or valet or anything. You just have to pull up and get dropped off. At 10:15 p.m. when we arrived, there was a HUGE tractor trailer with cars on it so we couldn't even pull up in front!!! I would definitely stay here again if I wanted something a bit less expensive than the giants downtown but clean, comfy, and up-to-date just like the good guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort in the University District”
Reviews.Author: Rumples
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Watertown and were extremely happy with our spacious room. It had a comfortable king bed, robes, Aveda products, a safe, an iron and ironing board, a wireless connection, Starbucks coffee and a cable TV. Our room faced the street, but we heard no traffic noise. We did hear occasional footsteps above us, however. The cleaning staff did an excellent job daily and the place was immaculate. The hotel has friendly, upbeat staff, who are happy to answer questions. On weekends, freshly baked chocolate chip cookies (the aroma fills the lobby) wait for guests at reception in the afternoon and a big bowl of apples is available. A Happy Hour (free wine and beer plus snacks) starts at 5:30 p.m. on weekdays. A small gym is located on the main floor near the breakfast room. The morning buffet includes fresh fruit, such as sliced oranges, honeydew melon and bananas; three kinds of cereal; baked goods, such as bagels, muffins and small scones; scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage; two kinds of juice; 2 percent and skimmed milk; and coffee and tea. The room is too small, though, to comfortably fit the number of guests who often arrive at the same time. On warm days, it is possible to go to tables outside, but Seattle is rarely warm early in the morning. Free, secure parking is an added bonus. You can simply park the car and take nearby bus transport Downtown or reserve a ride on the hotel's free shuttle (with a tip to the driver). The bus takes about 20 minutes to get downtown. It is an easy walk to the University of Washington and its museums and to shops, restaurants, movie theatres, etc., in the University area. I recommend the Cedars at 4759 Brooklyn Ave. for reasonably priced cuisine from India. The Burke Gilman Trail, for cyclists and pedestrians, stretches for miles about three blocks away from the hotel. I highly recommend the Watertown for visitors who do not need to be based Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding choice for Seattle Wa”
Reviews.Author: rocket-scientist
Reviews.Content: The Watertown Hotel is an outstanding choice for a place to stay in Seattle WA. Hotel is near Washington University. The rooms are modern, spacious, clean and comfortable. Hotel staff very helpful. Value is excellent. Weekday afternoons happy hour with free beer, wine, etc. Free shuttle service was provided to downtown tour buses and attractions. Lots of free private parking and an excellent security system for accessing room floors. Included breakfast was also better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Infrickincredible!”
Reviews.Author: belize2000
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel more than I can explain. We stayed for just one night the last night of our Seattle & Vancouver trip, and I found it to be the most comfortable and definitely the best value for the money. Seattle just isn't a very cheap place to stay. Granted, this hotel is in the university district, and so it's not quite as convenient as staying right downtown. But the same hotel downtown would be at least double the cost PLUS parking each night (we payed $30/night earlier that week). They've thought of everything at the Watertown--from the Aveda bath products to the complimentary wine/beer/snacks evening happy hour to fresh baked cookies at check-in (try the chocolate chip coconut macadamia ones--yum!) to the filtered tap water to the little general "store" by the front desk to loaner bikes to complimentary Starbucks coffee and tea round the clock in the lounge area to free parking to complimentary breakfast buffet to apples for the taking in the lobby to microwave and fridge, etc. Obviously, I could go on and on. We also had a great view of the city in a corner suite on the 6th floor--fabulous! One of the nicest parts of the Watertown was that we didn't feel nickel and dimed like we did at every other place we stayed at. I didn't even see a tip jar for any of these complimentary services--so refreshing (although we did tip the very helpful front desk person--maybe the manager--for above and beyond kindness)!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Watertown! Felt like I was back in University!”
Reviews.Author: purplecat22
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for 3 nights and we loved the location, price and free underground parking! My son especially loved the free breakfast each morning. The theme carts were a great idea, especially for the kids and ordering them was no hassle at all. The room decore and layout was fun, trendy and the kids loved the double access from the bathroom to the bedroom through the closet! The hotel is very much a serve yourself style hotel....when we requested a corkscrew and wine glasses, we were told they would be at the front desk for us to pick up. I have never had to retrieve my own requests before, they have always been brought up to my room! I suppose the lower price you are paying as compared to downtown Seattle, is that they don't have doormen or valet or experienced high end hotel staff! Think college, dorm room style! Overall, the experience was great and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: patriciadev
Reviews.Content: The Watertown provided excellent service for our stay. Karen was especially helpful and a joy to interact with! Make use of the shuttle, the free breakfast, the "a la carte" ammenity, and the free bicycles. The more we talked to the staff, the better our stay became. Patricia, Lake Charles, Louisiana

Reviews.Title: “nice offerings but pricey”
Reviews.Author: kcblue
Reviews.Content: greeted by friendly/helpful evening staff (great recommendation for dinner). Free underground/secure parking was bonus. Room was clean, comfortable with nice touches of alcohol pads by phone/remote, filtered tap water, micro, fridge & safe, robes for lounging (though not worth the $75 they were selling them for), cozy bed/pillows. Arrived late in evening so didn't partake of "ala carte" carts. The shower was decent...head high enough so my kind of tall husband didn't have to crouch, rounded curtain rod but shower/toilet area small to begin with, could have had more/larger towels available, Aveda products. Large sink/counter area but could have used the space to make shower/tub/hotel larger...especially in a suite room. No phone by bed, alarm clock complicated but not utilizing wake up call or alarm so didn't care too much. Breakfast & eating area was decent. I've had better buffets (no waffles) but lots of healthy choices. No highchair so eating w/ toddler challenging and no car seat available for us to utilize complimentary shuttle to shopping. Unfortunately fire alarm went off @ 6:45 AM (toaster in kitchen). Did try to extend stay and negotiate lower rate since we would have to change room. Morning desk staff not quite as helpful/friendly. No discount offered even w/ alarm snafu. Overall...a bit overpriced even for 'boutique' hotel though it had nice offerings. Have never stayed in a hotel that was unwilling to negotiate on rate. Good job by housekeeping - room immaculate. Don't get a room near ice machine. I felt guilty getting ice @ 10PM because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: europe-chick
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. We stayed 3 nights at the start of a month long trip - this was one of the nicest hotels we stayed in during our trip. Good choice of items at breakfast - only downside to the breakfast is that there are not that many tables and occasionally we had to wait for a table. Free shuttle to downtown is ideal if you don't want to drive in as parking is expensive. Free parking at the hotel. Loved the cookies n Starbucks coffee available 24/7. Loved the Aveda toiletries in the room. Our room on the 6th floor had a fantastic view of the Seattle skyline (think it was 603) Room itself was very spacious and modern, clean and looked to be fairly newly refurbished. Would not hesitate to stay here again or to reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and quality”
Reviews.Author: MacNews
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Watertown for a second year in a row as it is close to Gasworks Park for the fireworks on July 4th, was very pleased with the service. We used the shuttle for the first time and it was very convenient, dropping us off in the heart of downtown and operating until 9:30pm, not bad for a free shuttle. The house-keeping was great and came quickly when called for more toiletries. The 24-hour workout room (Rare for a hotel) and free breakfast were nice bonuses. The only frustration was the lack of inputs on the TVs, so you cannot hook up a Wii or any game system to it. Evidently the DVD cart comes with its own TV because even the staff cannot hook anything up to it. Overall a fantastic stay, 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suburban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Live64
Reviews.Content: Nice "chic" hotel in the area around the University of Washington. Great breakfast bar and afternoon drinks and snacks. The shuttle driver was great - he will drive you the 10-15 minutes to downtown. The rooms come in different sizes. The two other families we were traveling with had larger rooms - see if you can book something larger (especially if traveling with kids). Small well-appointed workout room. I was disappointed that one of the 4 cardio pieces was broken and the staff did not seem too concerned about getting it fixed. It hindered our family of 4 from working out together. Movie theater and restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel BUT.........”
Reviews.Author: nandme
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Watertown hotel for one evening. We loved this hotel when we arrived.... it's very clean, stylish, friendly and had some really nice touches that other hotels don't have (like the carts you can choose to make your stay more enjoyable.) We were feeling like we had found the best deal in Seattle until.... we slept in the bed. The bed was extremely firm. I generally travel with a memory foam pad when we travel because I like a softer bed but... the memory foam pad didn't make one bit of difference on this very firm bed. We called down to the desk the next morning to see if all the beds were this firm and ... unfortunately they were. We were planning to stay four evenings but... had to switch hotels after one night due to the bed. They were very understanding and accomodating and tried their best to help us with this situation. If you don't mind firm beds, this is a beautiful hotel with lots of accomodations and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - We would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Moe_Ipak
Reviews.Content: From the beginning to the end a great experience. The price was reasonable and very convenient for where we wanted. I know it's a little far from Pike place but it's not that far. I spoke with Karen Floyd, and she is one of the friendliest staff to deal with anywhere. They also booked our round trip transportation from the airport which was smooth at a very reasonable cost. The breakfast was free and there were a lot of options. The amenities in the room where great. Free tea and coffee 24 hours was a great service also. The nice warm cookies in the evening were great. All the staff was more then friendly to assist you with anything. I booked a rent a car with enterprise and they gave me a discount because the hotel recommended it. They are about half a mile from the hotel. The spa cart was nice. They had a crib in the room as requested. Overall a great experience and I for one would go back in a heart beat. For the price I paid, I think I got more.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scuby20
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Watertown Hotel, and I LOVE it. My daughter had to be seen by a doctor at the Seattle Children's hospital. We wanted to stay at a hotel the night before, since her appointment was so early in the morning. She is only a year, and takes a lot of work to get ready in the morning, and coming all the way from Olympia is a long drive so early. I read the reviews prior to booking and decided to go ahead and book a night there. They offer a discounted rate for families that have kids going to or staying at the hospital. I called several hotels and asked them if they had a hospital discount, and while they did it was MUCH more expensive. I was also concerned about safety. I wanted inside rooms, and secure free parking, which is very hard to find in the U area. They had a very secure garage to part in, and the elevator would only take you to the lobby if you don't have a key. You have to have your room key to get to the guest room floors, which I think is just Wondeful!! really makes you feel secure. After we checked in, we went up to our room and we were quite impressed. We love that the closet doors open from the living area, and the bathroom area...so you don't have to tramp naked to the bed/living area, you can access your clothes from the bathroom area. Most hotel's "closets" are on the other end of the room from the bathroom. They also provide 2 robes to use while you are there. Their bath products were nice. the tv was pretty cool, they have it on a swiveling/slididng base, and you can actually turn the tv and watch it while you are getting ready in the bathroom. The mirror and sink area are seperate from the shower. For women, this is a plus. We don't have to stand in the steam to put our makeup on, while our husbands/kids are taking a shower. the room was small, but the way it is layed out, we had plenty of room, even with our stroller inside the room. Now here is the best thing. They have these alacartes that you can request, before you arrive and it will be waiting in your room when you get there. They have a Seattle one in all the rooms, but you can request another one. They have artistic ones (that come with things to draw and paint and such) they have a movie watching one, an internet one, where they bring you a laptop and printer, and many many more. The one thing I would suggest to the hotel, is make the full list available on line, and when customers call to book an appointment, let them know about the many carts. But this is minor......We arrived at the hotel to late to request one. (there are certain hours only that you can request a cart)....We didn't realize they had a baby cart, with toys, wipes, takalong bibs, plastic kid spoon and fork, disposable sippie cups...lots of stuff perfect for babies.....and they include several outlet covers, so you can plug up the outlets and not worry about your baby sticking something in them. Well we asked the front desk clerk Jessica who was Wonderful!!! She not only suggested a great little italian place just a few blocks away....she said she would see about getting the baby cart and putting it in our room....even though the hours to request one is closed. She was just so sweet and nice, and gave my daughter a little rubber ducky that she got to keep. All of the staff were so nice and more than willing to bend over backwards for customers. We got there to late to enjoy the wine tasting on weeknights, but I'm sure that would be fun. We did partake in breakfast and I enjoyed it. Some other people commented on the quality of the breakfast, but it's free and it's available for several hours......when you are trying to get a 1 year old up early, and dressed...it's nice to just stroll downstairs and get some breakfast. I have stayed in a lot of hotels over my lifetime, and most continental breakfasts don't have hot food.....they have scrambled eggs and sausages. along with bagels, toast, muffins, scones, fresh fruit, SOY MILK (what hotel offers that?, none...this one is great), milk, OJ (it did taste a little sunny D like, but hey it was still good and nice and cold). Their muffins were really good. They also had yogurt (wonderful for kids, my daughter loves yogurt) and several different cereals....The coffee and tea are available 24/7....so that is a great thing too, though they give you a bag of starbucks coffee and a coffee maker in your room too. Overall this experience was Wonderful!!!!! I am not a really picky person, but I am a clean freak and this place was Spotless. My husband travels a lot and stays in a lot of hotels around the world, nice ones at that...and he can always find some mold or hair or dirt in the bathrooms....I'm telling you, I'm a germaphobe and this plact was SPOTLESS. So spotless, I decided to give my daughter a bath that night before her doctor appt the next day. They even had a bath mat to put down, so she didn't slide around, and it was clean too......The beds were comfy, and the option of 2 different kind of pillows is just awesome!! I usually bring my down pillow everywhere, because I can't sleep with anything else. I forgot to bring it this time, and had no problems, I used one of their synthetic pillows, and it was Great....obviously from nice quality, not a discount store special. The sheets and comforters were nice, and clean! I have never written a review on a hotel before, I'm not usually one to do that unless it's really bad, or really really good. This hotel exceeded all of my expectations. I have never been treated so nicely by staff in all my life...they are just wonderful. I thank Jessica (the night clerk on the 2nd) for bending over backwards and getting my daughter the baby cart. She really enjoyed it and I can't tell you much that was appreciated. The morning staff were just as nice, and just ooed and awed over my daughter, and they were all talking to her and saying hello....she was the center of their attention for a few minutes, and she loved that. the Only thing I would suggest to the hotel, is update their hours of the cart availablility and the wine tasting in all the rooms. I found like 4 different times for all of them, and wasn't sure the real time lol....but that is so minor it's hardly worth mentioning. My daughter unfortunatly has to have surgery next month and we Will be staying at this hotel for a few nights!!!! I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE coming to the area. They even have shuttles to take you to the local attractions and hospitals...though we drove ourself to the hospital, it's nice to know if we didn't want to we could have requested a shuttle to take us there. This hotel is top notch and I will be staying here again. Thank you so much for the wonderful stay, and we look forward to another wonderful stay next month.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but the furniture needs to be replaced”
Reviews.Author: markasaurus
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel once before, about two years ago, and was very impressed at that time. I was planning another trip to Seattle and was able to get a great rate through AAA, and saw no reason not to return. On looking at the first room, we realized that all the furniture was filthy. There were strange stains on the ottoman, and the couch. We asked to be changed to a new room, which they did immediately. The new room was only slightly better. I'm not saying the room was dirty, because it was not. The furniture clearly needed to be replaced though. I put this on the comment card and we were emailed after returning home with an apology from the manager and an assurance that the rooms would be taken out of service and the problem remedied immediately. I would still stay there again, the breakfast, wine tastings and complimentary bike rental more than made up for the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: travelwork
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a few nights stay at this hotel, which I chose after reading all the glowing reviews at TripAdvisor. The reviewers were spot on in prepping me for the ups and downs of this hotel. I stayed near the Needle when in Seattle last year and had done some exploring then and had figured out the city somewhat, so was curious about staying in the U district and wasn't disappointed with that choice. I agree with another reviewer that it is important to know what you're doing if you're going to stay near the U vs. downtown or Queen Anne. But the hotel has a shuttle service with very accommodating and helpful drivers, it's easy to use and readily available, as is their car service which you can reserve for rides to and from the airport. I used their car service for a one day conference in Bellevue and was pleased with how that worked out. The hotel also can call cabs for you if it's not during shuttle hours, and they come right away and are helpful too. The front desk staff was pretty good, helpful and friendly. Every once in a while I asked a question that confused them, but there was someone else to ask and they did their best to make sure I had correct answers to my questions. Fitness room was adequate - heck, Seattle has so many outdoor fitness options, including bicycles and helmets to borrow at the hotel - so you don't have to settle for the fitness room as the only option. Breakfast was adequate as well, more than ample choices and it was decent and available over several hours which was nice. Breakfast and happy hour with wine and beer and little snacks on the weeknights were included with the room price. There are plenty of other hotels in Seattle in higher price ranges that don't offer nearly as much as this place does. The rooms are pretty nice, a little on the small side (at least the studio I had was a little small, but you're not in the room that much), but they seem European in feeling, with windows that open and very clean and well appointed, lots of nice pillows and modern fixtures and bathrobes and decent bath products. The A La Carte option is also fun, and a nice free feature. AAA discount offers decent rates. And on the last night, since housekeeping forgot to make up my room, the front desk made a special deal for me to make up for that disappointment, which was greatly appreciated. It is a wonderful selling point to have that kind of service which is more than willing to go out of their way when it's their oversight causing a guest disappointment. I don't always find this level of service at hotels that are more expensive, so it goes a long way when hotel staff are willing to pay that extra attention to guest comforts and complaints. The Watertown certainly has another fan!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service, but inconvient location”
Reviews.Author: bdancause
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Watertown for 6 nights during a recent business trip. Overall, we were very impressed with the quality of the amenities of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff. The location, however, was fairly far from the downtown tourist hub. Reservation Process We were part of a group reservation for the beginning of our trip so I made my reservation directly through the hotel. The person taking our reservation was very helpful and courteous. When I asked what the rate would be to extend our stay past the room block, she quoted a reasonable rate. I told her that I was going to first check if there was anything around that rate downtown and get back to her. She strongly encouraged me to do so soon since they were filly up quickly. When I looked online, everything downtown was 1.5 to 2 times pricier than the Watertown, so we decided to stay here. The reservation agent also gave us the name of a town car service we could use for airport transfers. The service was cheaper than taking a taxi. Rooms The rooms were very modern and pretty spacious. The corner of the room had floor to ceiling windows. No special view but allowed for a lot of light. The bathroom had a separate vanity area from the shower/toilet area which made getting ready easy. I also liked that the TV was on a swivel and we could watch the tv from the bath while getting ready in the morning. We had 2 queen beds that were the most comfortable mattress I have ever slept on before. I really liked that they color coded their pillows (white were hypoallergenic and cream were feather). The maid service was attentive enough to notice that I had a definite preference for hypoallergenic and made the bed up accordingly each day. The bath products were Aveda. I was disappointed that we were only given shampoo, bath bar and lotion- I was counting on conditioner which we did not get. I did not make use of the cart service (a unique amenity) but had a colleague who ordered the Spa Cart and loved it! I wish I had known about it before checking in and I would have reserved the Sweet Dreams cart (there are more carts available than just those listed on their web site). The rooms also had a mini-fridge (empty) and microwave so you could grab something lite from a nearby store for a snack. Breakfast was remarkably good for a free service although the juice glasses could have doubled as shot glasses (they were tiny). We took advantage of the the free happy hour one 2 nights and liked mingling with other guests. We did not make use of the bicycles but saw many that did. The rooms were very clean (although my carpet seemed to have a stain) and would pass a white glove test for dust. Service The staff were always very pleasant and quick to acknowledge me when I was around. They would ask me if I needed assistance even before I got a chance to ask. We asked for advice on directions and restaurant recommendations several times. Shuttle Service The drivers were very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. My one complaint with this service is that it fills up very quickly. We had to pre-plan all of our trips downtown and had to plan based on when a spot was open on the shuttle. It is not available on an ad hoc request basis as I thought it might be. We also had to share with the sister property at University Inn, which competed for seats. Location The biggest drawback for me was the location of the hotel. If you are not a fan of walking a lot, then the location can seem like it is in the middle of nowhere. We walked about a mile away to a local neighborhood area for some eclectic restaurant fare. The University is about a 20 minute walk and the downtown area requires a 20 minute shuttle ride (depending on traffic). There didn't seem to be any appealing restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, buuuuuuuut”
Reviews.Author: GatorSteve
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the great reviews we booked this hotel for our pre-cruise stay in Seattle. We had advised the hotel that we would not be arriving until very late (actually the next morning) . After flying a redeye all the way from Tampa FL and arriving at the hotel at 3 AM we were told by the night auditor that he had cancelled our reservation but could put us in a room, whatever at this point but he put us in a room with 2 double beds, not the king we had guaranteed. After going down to the desk again and pursuing it we were finally shown to a very nice suite which was an upgrade over our original room. He couldn't figure out how to correct the rate but assured me it would be taken care of by the manager in the morning. Sure enough the next morning I spoke with the day manager and was assured it would be taken care of. After enjoying the breakfast provided and a day of sightseeing in Seattle, we returned to find the room had not been cleaned. Once again, I contacted the front desk and after an apologie the room was cleaned, sort of, they made the bed and changed the towels but did not vacuum or even give us fresh coffee for the coffee maker. The next morning at checkout our bill was indeed corrected to the proper rate. I asked the desk clerk to call us a cab to take us to the port and instead they called a limosine service they use. The price was only $25 so I didn't complain but it wasn't what I asked for. Overall, we found the hotel average at best. The Avida products and furnishings provided a nice touch and the free shuttle downtown was convenient but the problems we had though somewhat resolved don't allow me give a better review. NO traveler at 3AM who has guaranteed a room should EVER have to worry that there room isn't available after it has been paid for. There is NO excuse for that. The proper way to have handled it after holding us up would have been to comp the room for that night , especially after it wasn't even cleaned the next day. All in all sort of amateurish way to run a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice but some problems”
Reviews.Author: chgo207
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at the watertown hotel. the location can not be beat for access to the university and it is just a short ride to the downtown area. the rooms are comfortable, the breakfast is excellent (for a complimentary buffet) and the overall feel of the hotel is very nice. we did however encounter more than one problem with the service which is billed as "legendary"........the shuttle driver was on time but not at all friendly or helpful with suggestions or directions (beyond handing us a map when we exited the van). at the hotel, our requested wake up call never came. the car service (which is affiliated with the hotel) that the hotel staff set up for our return trip to the airport, did not show up (they finally did call us a cab but by then we were late and it was more expensive than the arranged car service). I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to stay in the university area but at the same time, I would caution you to not depend on the staff to make arrangements for any plans that are not flexible.

Reviews.Title: “Watertown compared”
Reviews.Author: MasterDJ
Reviews.Content: So many nice hotels to chose from in Seattle, settled for 2 nites in Pan Pacific and 1 in Watertown. This due to location as we needed to go to the zoo for daughter . Watertown is about 5 minutes away driving from zoo. Downtown is actually close too. While PP was a business like modern classic, Watertown was a Hip modern. Even the room key jacket is a clever folded map of Seattle. The hotel itself is new and very nice. Things i did not like, although not a big minus: - Nice floor to ceiling glass window walls did not have a liner curtain but only the thick light blocking one. Although one assumes that it is dark if looked from outside, not confy to walk in undies with curtains up unless u r a stripper or in good shape( I am neither). Specially since we are facing a construction site and lots of workers. Also our room did not have much outside lighting so had to have lights on most of the time. - Construction noise/view was bad during day. But this seems to be common sight in Seattle as we had the same with PanPacific room. - My wife felt the bed was a bit on the soft side for her likings. I guess this was compared to PP. - Coming from the PP awesome bathroom, Watertown's was small and no separate glass shower stall. The outstanding plus: - Parking underground hotel is free/great, elevator connects to lobby and room. - Well stocked free breakfast, although nothing out of the ordinary. Compares to a hampton inn ones. Other observations: - Wifi would not connect even though it sees the net( No, I am not network illiterate). Used the provided wired lan. No prob. - Did not use any of the amenities, which looked very very good. Overall, can't go wrong with this hotel. Will be happy to stay again here. But as a middle age level family, on the pampering level, we preffered Pan Pacific of the two. If going to Seattle in April, make sure you go to the tulip festival. Acres and acres of colorful tulips. Will make your lady smile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Smitty615
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights here at the Watertown and cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the service. Many extras not usually found in a hotel at this price range make for a very comfortable stay: free Internet, cookies in the afternoon, free Happy Hour every weekday, hot breakfast, complimentary shuttle service to downtown, and much more. The front desk people could not be nicer or more helpful. The rooms and beds are very comfortable and very clean. An excellent choice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: CMJEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference near the university. It is clear that a lot of effort has been put in to making a stay at the Watertown a relaxing, enjoyable experience. The staff was helpful and friendly, the room spotlessly clean and the little touches like Aveda bath products, Tazo tea and Starbucks coffee are appreciated. My room looked out over a construction area across the street but the windows blocked out virtually all the noise. The "a la cart" program is a great idea too, A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch and friendly and kind”
Reviews.Author: CintiKid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I sought a comfortable place to stay near a wedding we were attending, and we found it. A reasonably price hotel, well designed, with all the comforts available. Breakfast was very suitable to our low fat low sugar needs. The Portage restaurant a block away served a great lunch (organic, tasty, but noisy). Super quiet room and comfie bed. heating worked well. only problem was the room design by which a light at the wash basin shone in the bedroom, waking spouse. efficient exercise room, readily available internet. very helpful front desk. and you have read others' favorable comments as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clarinet_dude
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights in this very new, very nice hotel. The staff was friendly, the room spacious and quiet and the free breakfast pretty decent. We really appreciated the small touches like no TV in the breakfast room - they played quality jazz on the stereo at reasonable volume. They even had Tazo tea in the room, and a place to recycle paper. The free shuttle service was great. Even on the day we left, after checkout time, we were able to get a shuttle downtown, and a ride back so we could pick up our car and not have to pay the exorbitant fees to park. We didn't get a chance to use any of the other features in the hotel like the free carts (ask the hotel about this) or the free bicycles. We would stay in this hotel again and will the next time we are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: johawaii
Reviews.Content: Cute boutique hotel w/ large modern rooms w/ all the little extras. It was much better than our room in downtown, which cost alot more. Free parking is a plus. Would definitely return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in the U District”
Reviews.Author: pcha72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Watertown for 4 days for business. Nice, spacious rooms, comfortable beds and pillows, and I loved the big mirror! The main reason I booked this hotel, though, was the secure underground parking, since I was travelling alone. I felt safe at all times and it helped that I didn't have to walk out in the rain to get to my car! The staff was excellent as well; very friendly and responded promptly to my needs. Breakfast was a nice bonus. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking to stay in the University District.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Maybe not romantic, but definitely fun and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: bethana
Reviews.Content: We had a positive experience overall here! The people on staff, while young, were very friendly and helpful. There's nothing extra-ordinary about the hotel itself, but I think what really sold me in the first place were the unique amenities. I LOVE that they had bikes and helmets for loan that were in excellent condition. The trail is only a few blocks from the hotel, and we took advantage of a rare sunny winter day to bike through UW and down to the Gasworks Park. The second amenity that we loved were the ala carts. I requested the spa cart which came with a CD player and relaxing CD, bath products, etc. I think this is an ingenious idea to personalize a hotel stay as there are various carts to choose from. Third, just little touches like free secured parking, aveda bath products, bath robes, fresh cookies in the lobby, wine tastings, a general store with Trader Joe's snacks, a recycle bin in the room, a map built into your room key holder. The room itself was very clean, and while it had a nautical theme, the decor was not gaudy or tasteless. The setup of the room was smartly designed with appliances tucked in with the clothing closet. My only complaints are that the tub was pretty small, the breakfast was so-so, and the lights around the vanity were fluorescent and therefore made doing makeup and hair difficult. I appreciate that the hotel is striving to be "green"-- kudos-- but splurge on the vanity lights please. The location was convenient because we had our own car, but I could see getting around to be a bit difficult if you had business downtown to attend to every day. Because it is in the university district, restaurants are less upscale (but cheaper!) and your peers are probably younger than you. :) As stated in the title, I don't think this hotel is a great romantic escape, but a good way to have fun with your partner experiencing all of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great urban hotel with many free extras!!”
Reviews.Author: traveldogsIdaho
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the University district. While it's not a luxury hotel, it is however very modern, clean, comfortable and above average. There are many free things that make it worth the stay such as the great breakfast, secure parking, newspaper at your door, microwave popcorn, good coffee, robes, and the free fun ala carts delivered to your room. Parking is a premium in Seattle so having it free and safe is a big plus. The Aveda products are also a very nice touch, so much better than cheap shampoo, etc. The area felt safe for walking around, even at night. You're close to great shopping all around, University Village is 1.5 miles away. Downtown is also close, about a 10-15 minute drive. I would stay here again. It's in a good area that is centrally located and close, easy access to I-5 freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely surprise for a University Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1024
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a visit to UW and was pleasantly surprised by all the extras at this nice boutique hotel. Complimentary cookies in the lobby plus ample breakfasts, feather pillows, microwave and popcorn in the room, spacious bathroom with nice spa amenities, etc. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: moab
Reviews.Content: A great deal if you don't mind staying in the U district. A very nice boutique hotel with all the little touches that make it a special stay. Free underground secure parking, complimentary wine tasting 7 nights a week, a complimentary breakfast that's more substantial than a continental, free shuttle to key Seattle attractions, Aveda spa products, fridge and microwave in the King deluxe rooms. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel was quiet on a Friday night. Very clean and the staff was very cordial. I'll definitely go back and recommend this to anyone. I wish we'd stayed for more than one night!

Reviews.Title: “One of Seattle's Best”
Reviews.Author: Mackenson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Watertown twice. Both times we have been extremely impressed, and I would definately recommend this hotel as a great alternative for travelers or locals looking for a getaway. What we liked: - The rooms were HUGE. I can only refer to my experience in the Suite Studios, but I was amazed at the size of these rooms. Very open and comfortable. - Very clean - Courteous staff - Simple, modern furnishings with a bit of nautical flair. It has a nice urban feel, without being aggressively modern and cold (I'm looking at you, "W Hotel"). - Nice, central location close to I-5, downtown, Greenlake, UW, the zoo, etc. - Themed complimentary carts are a cute idea - Free parking - Not quite as expensive as most Seattle downtown and upscale hotels - Very quiet. Seems like they have good sound-proofing to keep the noise of the city out. Things we didn't like: - Additional $10 for each person (beyond the first) seems like an odd pricing structure. It's only $10, but that is somewhat irritating when you are already paying a a fairly high rate + state tax + hotel tax. If you're traveling as a family, this is going to get very expensive. - Parking garage might be a bit difficult to maneuverer around in when it's crowded - Views from most rooms are not particularly fabulous. I imagine there's a couple that will give you a nice view of Downtown, but everything else tends to face nondescript neighborhoods and office buildings. And, that's really my only negatives. All-in-all, the Watertown will be our destination when we are looking for a Seattle getaway. It's friendly, fun, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “An above average hotel with some nice bells and whistles”
Reviews.Author: groovyvegan
Reviews.Content: Based on the great reviews here at Trip Advisor, I booked a stay here for over a week, and have mostly liked the place. The Watertown hotel has great bells and whistles, but first let's look at the basics: * Room size and layout - We had a suite--no complaints there. I especially liked having 2 sinks, one across from the bed and one next to the bathroom door. * Bed comfort - Excellent with a nice pillowtop mattress. * Cleanliness - Some hairs left behind from previous guest, but otherwise good. * Helpfulness of staff - Quite good. * Quietness - Here's where they fall down. We heard lots of noise from the room above. Very easy to hear footsteps above you. However, they appear to have double-paned windows, and you can't hear much noise from outside. On the weekend, there were a lot of teenagers talking noisily in the hallway, but the halls were quiet at all other times. * Temperature control - A bit difficult. The thermostat says high heat, low heat, high cool, low cool and fan only.
