Reviews.Content: Easy to see why this little gem is listed as one of Seattle's top five. I've stayed in Hilton's in Melbourne Australia, Thistle Hotels in London and none compared to the simple pleasures and friendliness experienced at the Watertown! Be sure to take advantage of their Ala carte service. First time I've ever had a business center come to me. And if you've come to sleep - these are the absolute best beds I've encountered in a hotel - bar none.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Free Bikes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with lots of nice touches. We stayed in June and had a fabulous time making full use of the free bicycles to travel around Seattle - the pool and the gym are very good too. I loved the little touches, like the free trolley, delivered to the room, with the foot spa, back massager and chill-out music. The wine tasting was another lovely touch. In fact, there are so many free 'extras' that it is hard to fit them all in. The rooms are very modern, without being stark and the location is great. The free taxi to the downtown area was also a boon and the staff were incredibly friendly with great service all round. The hotel was very reasonably priced and I would recommend it most highly. The hotel manages to anticipate what its guests might enjoy and succeeds in ensuring that they feel welcome and pampered. We came back to the UK fitter and more relaxed - which can't be bad. I only wish hotels in the UK could meet these kind of standards.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another great weekend at the Watertown in Seattle. The rooms are great, especially the layout, with the beds on one side and the washroom on the other, separated by a console/closet. The beds are comfy and we loved the pillows. The staff are very helpful and friendly and we like the area. It's close to the University Mall and far enough out of downtown that it's very quiet. Even the parking lot is super clean! We love this hotel and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Watertown”
Reviews.Author: sleepycow
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience. The staff couldn't be more helpful, the only problem is that they are going to burn themselves out if they keep going at this rate. We stayed first of all in the Boardroom Suite then in the View Suite - with great views. Well worth just walking up to 'The Ave' just a few blocks away, to visit the 'quirky' shops in the University district.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Watertown. Quiet, comfortable and great staff. I would return again without question.

Reviews.Title: “A delicious destination”
Reviews.Author: Norimaki
Reviews.Content: I love the Watertown. I stay there every time I'm in Seattle. Myself and my girlfriend spent our third weekend there last month and were as impressed as always by the generous and delicious buffet breakfast, the loaner bikes they have for guests, the clean, bright, airy feel of the lobby and rooms. This was for our first time getting one of the more expensive rooms, and gasp, what a great room! A corner room, with jacuzzi tub, spacious, hip colour scheme. We were both loathe to leave the room. And those spa/ games/ music carts... what a nice touch. Worth the cab ride from town every time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, spotty service, questionable value”
Reviews.Author: ChgoDiver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Watertown this past weekend. Overall, I was impressed with the property, but thought the breakfast and service needed improvement. Room: Fantastic view. Fairly comfortable beds (I have stayed in more comfortable hotel beds). Very spacious and well-appointed, including an enormous mirror. I thought the bathroom vanity area was nice, but the actual water closet (toilet and tub/shower) was completely neglected by the designers. The toilet and the tub were on top of each other in this tiny room. Although clean, this tiny room had no shower tiles and no color. I have been in hospital restrooms nicer than this area. It was cramped and sterile. The room had three bath towels, but only one washcloth and two handtowels which seemed a little parsimonious. The Aveda products are always a nice touch. Common areas: Very tastefully done. Clean and inviting. The hotel has free internet access which was convenient to print out our boarding pass. Fitness area was nice, but very small. Housekeeping: No complaints. Continental breakfast: Needs some work. The french toast was cold and spongy and the pastries far from fresh. The cereal was mislabeled and the milk and orange juice were not kept on ice or cool. Better off getting a warm $6 breakfast at the IHOP a block and a half down from the hotel. Service: At times the service was friendly and competent at other times, it was aloof and unhelpful. For instance, we asked for a map of the area because we intended to take out their free rental bikes (which was a nice amenity). They did not have a map of the area to give to us. It did not appear to be that they ran out of maps, it simply appeared that the hotel simply never contemplated getting a map of the area for their guests. The next day we planned to meet some friends in a different area of the city. We asked the front desk for a map, and again they did not have a map of Seattle to provide to us. To be fair, they did tell us how to get there, but it would have been nice to have had a map. On the other hand, the front desk quickly arranged for a Town Car to pick us up for the airport which was appreciated. I have to agree with the prior reviewer: there is a lackadaisical approach to the front desk staff. They are nice, but they really don't seem to be well-trained in professionalism or knowledge of the area. Perhaps, I would not be so critical of the service and the food if the room was cheaper. However, the high room rate was simply not commensurate with the service and the food that we received. Watertown is probably your best bet in the area if you are looking for a better than average hotel room, but don't expect great service, food or value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: These reviewers were clearly hired by the hotel. The only things that were good about the hotel were the aveda products and the big mirror. Very inexperienced and unprofessional staff treat their guests terribly. I talked to other guests with similar opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ZweiHunde
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a night at the Watertown hotel near the University of Washington campus due in large part to the positive reviews posted on this web site. I must say the reviews were right on. This is a well designed hotel with large rooms(King studio), decent location, nice beds, good service and great added extras(wine tasting, free bike use and underground parking). My wife and I also stayed at the Westin downtown on this trip and the only advantages the Westin has are location and views. Although the Watertown isn't Downtown Seattle it has easy access to great area restaurants (we enjoyed Serafina). The Watertown has 4* accommodations at 3* prices and is worth the savings if you don't mind driving or taking the free shuttle down town. I would also recommending biking through the UW campus the beauty is worth the hills!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Watertown August 19-21, based on recommendation of a friend who stayed there before, as well as all the great reviews on TripAdvisor. I thought the beds were comfortable, and I loved the decor - though if more than 2 people had lots of clothing, there were not a lot of drawers. Did not discover popcorn until we left! Cookies were good, and wine-tasting was fun. Breakfast was satisfactory. We had one of the rooms on a higher floor -view was overlooking vacant lot and parking lot, as well as part of Seattle skyline and Mt Rainier. Loved being by University of Washington and strolling up and down University Way. Restaurants and stores within a few minutes walk -like different ethnic restaurants. A couple of drugstores to pick up "last minute" items before our cruise. We did not have a car, used hotel shuttle bus (make reservation in advance for shuttle). There are also city buses that you can take into downtown (cabs are not cheap).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girls were Watertown guests just a few days ago. We stayed for three nights, and liked it there. It's located near the University, in a quiet neighborhood with some good restaurants - nearly every cuisine you desire - within walking distance. It's a nice, clean hotel, and the service staff were very friendly. Most of the front desk staff, a younger bunch, seemed a bit cold, except for one very nice young woman. The breakfast, in my opinion, was nothing to write home about. It was a continental buffet of boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, bagels microwaveable french toast, fruit, juice and milk. There are nice places in the area that offer a full breakfast, so if you're looking for good food, try those. Overall, it's a nice, comfortable place, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MtotheC
Reviews.Content: The Watertown Hotel is a really decent place to stay in terms of both quality and value. Our large twin room was clean and comfortable, with Aveda bath products and even a discreet microwave complete with popcorn! The contintental breakfast which is included in the price is also good, you can have bagels, cereal, toast, as well as Starbucks coffee and juice. Plus, don't worry about the fact that it's not 'in town', as you can take a bus from right outside (it really doesn't take long, about 15 mins), or book a place on the free shuttle bus service. It's also really close to the arty enclave of Freemont, which has numerous funky resturants and boutiques. In fact, instead of going downtown, we preferred going there or to nearby Wallingford for dinner. And for no extra cost, you can also have the fun of choosing a 'cart' for your room which you can have for the duration of your stay. There's the TV/DVD cart ( which we chose), the internet cart, the pampering cart, the baby cart etc.. etc... You don't have to take it but it's a nice touch. Also, if you're driving, parking in the underground car park is included in the price. Result!

Reviews.Title: “Watertown Hotel -- Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: markOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: This place is a dream -- we had a great, spacious room. There's a funky, modern, upbeat feeling to the lobby and all of the public spaces. The price includes parking and breakfast, and there is free winetasting every evening. The only downside is that the neighborhood is a little unsavory after dark. But if you have your own car, you can drive directly into the hotel's underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “they lost my online reservation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved Watertown hotel on one of the internet travel sites. I printed my confirmation number, rate details, itinerary, address, contact information, credit card verification. All this was a good 6 weeks before the reservation date. Fortunately I arrived into seattle very early in the morning. It was not too late in the afternoon when I called Watertown to confirm. What? no record. They had absolutely no record of my name, my reservation, or my claim to a room. And of course, a Friday night, they had no room for me. Possibly it is not their fault. But I'm confident it is not my mistake, so it could only be an issue between them and the internet site. They were helpful about calling some places for me, to their credit, and helped me find a different place to stay. For these reasons, and the fact that this scale only goes as low as 1, I won't give them a zero for the review. Clearly there are some loose ends with their Internet sales and marketing. I would have liked very much to enjoy the place, but was prevented this time. Hope all of you have better luck.

Reviews.Title: “cool urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very cool urban hotel. Just a few problems: 1) they booked me and several other guests for the wrong month that day and did not handle the situation very well, 2) room smelled moldy, 3) they have a very friendly inexperienced staffed who accidently charged my room for another room's drycleaning but they did not know who to correct this so i had to wait for several days until their manager got back to have this credited to my credit card

Reviews.Title: “terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: toot-toot
Reviews.Content: Watertown feels like Scandanavia or northern Europe. Rooms are so clean, modern, and spacious. Natural lighting is excellent for a middle room. Furnishing are contemporary. Breakfast bar serves healthy choices and wine tasting hours are really fun. Great staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the chocolate-chip cookies!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thurstonator
Reviews.Content: Nightly wine tasting, funky rooms, yummy cookies, super shuttle service, free parking & helpful staff...all within walking distance to the BEST ice cream shop... Need I say more???

Reviews.Title: “way cool watertown!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the watertown 2 nights and absolutely loved it! our room was immaculate and hip decor. we felt very safe with the room key use in the elevator and parking below was perfect. hubby loved the high speed internet and i had fun with the spa cart.....it didn't all work perfect but was free so no biggy. room even had free microwave popcorn-yum. the shuttle service was great for going downtown; saved us from parking and getting lost. plenty of restaurants and espresso within walking distance and trader joe's right up the street. we enjoyed walking around all the funky shops a couple blocks away on 'the ave'. free breakfast was good and convenient. all the staff were very nice and professional, although did have 2 phone calls not returned. our room was quiet, a/c worked great and the bed was beyond comfortable! loved the aveda products. check in and out was quick. just can't say enough good things about watertown and we really hope to stay again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: amye1976
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days on Orcas Island and 4 days in Seattle for our honeymoon in July. After reading all the wonderful reviews on the Watertown we decided to stay there for our Seattle adventure. The budget price and breakfast bar sealed the deal. Then we arrived at the Watertown..it was around 3:30pm in the afternoon. Our room wasn't yet ready, we waited about 15 minutes in the lobby. Not a huge deal. The staff was very nice and accomodating. We stayed in one of the suites...it was quite a large room, but the couch had many visible stains on it and there were hairs in the jacuzzi tub. Eeeeew. The bed was comfortable, the views were of the tops of buildings though, the Aveda products were a nice touch, the breakfast was wonderful. Overall it was an okay place to stay. I don't think we'll ever stay there again. It had a very cold feeling to us, even though the staff was very warm, more of a business traveler hotel I think.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Manoavalley
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Watertown several times in the past two years. It is convenient to the University of Washington and all of its activities. The rooms are always clean, bright and spacious. The free high speed internet access is important for our work. The staff is always helpful but could smile more often. A great amenity is the wine tasting at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at the Watertown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EtherTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family of four enjoyed a three night stay at the Watertown Hotel over July 4th weekend. The hotel was refreshingly pleasant - including the front desk staff's efficient check-in; the clean, bright and large room; the fine continental breakfast and the absolutely brilliant loaner bikes [our family biked to the Chittenden Locks and Discovery Park - awesome!]. Special kudos to Jeff Jackson for the top-notch shuttle service and great recommendation for the right spot from which to view the Lake Union fireworks on July 4th.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay in Watertown”
Reviews.Author: fluffymichou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown hotel after reading all the great reviews. Definitely it is a nice, clean hotel in a safe quiet neighborhood, right by Safeco. All the rooms have a modern, clean style. the hotel itself is quite new, maybe 5-10 years old. the parking is free (which is a plus considering downtown hotels charge for parking). the complimentary breakfast is a very generous buffet consisting of boiled eggs, frozen waffles, selection of teas and starbucks coffee, jam, butter, toast, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, some fresh fruits. within walking distance, there are plentiful restaurants just one street over, situated right by the university of washington where you can get good cheap eats and soak in the college atmosphere. other amenities that are nice include aveda hair and skin products in the bathrooms, and you can get a complimentary cart. i got the spa cart which had some nice bath products and a foot massager and relaxing cd. the only gripe i had is driving in to downtown seattle for tourist activities may prove a chore as seattle traffic can be a bit bad. i might try a downtown hotel next time i visit seattle, just to get a better feel for the sophistication of this city. overall though, Watertown is a great hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: kawai888
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 recently stayed at the Watertown hotel. It is a new hotel and our room (2 queen beds) are tastefully decorated. The bath soaps and lotions came from Aveda, a well know brand. The windows are insulted and you don't hear the noise from the streets. The staff, who must be all college students, are very attentive and friendly. The breakfast buffet is good and definitely a step up from the breakfast from other chain hotels such as residence inn or hampton inn. Since this is a new hotel, all the beddings and furnitures look and feel like new. We asked for a computer cart and it kept the kids busy surfing the internet. THere isn't much tourist activities close by but good resturants and shops are all within short driving distance. U of Washingon is next door and the hotel will lend you a bike to ride around campus. Great exercise during the summer. Overall, a good hotel and a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Meem1
Reviews.Content: My teenagers and I stayed at the Watertown for 2 nights while on a college tour of the Pacific Northwest. We chose the hotel based on previous TripAdvisor reviews and had a wonderful stay. We appreciated the very nice though smallish room, large windows and natural light, Temperpedic mattresses, fresh and fun decor, nice quiet hotel, friendly and very helpful staff, very nice breakfast, helpful pre-booking website information, the "spa cart" (easily ordered in advance via e-mail request and waiting in our room on arrival), free and secure underground parking, secure elevator access to upper floors, quiet neighborhood, and proximity to the University. It was perfect for us. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review for Watertown”
Reviews.Author: Bunnypug
Reviews.Content: Overall the Watertown property is fresh and original. I appreciated that parking and breakfast are included. The public space features good artwork and interesting design elements. Our board room suite was spacious and well appointed. Comfortable bed and linens, charming porthole in the bathroom door, Aveda bath products, fridge, microwave, dining table for 6.... However, service was disappointing. We stayed at the Watertown because we were attending a wedding. When I called to confirm our reservation, I was told check in is at 3 but you are welcome to come early. We arrived at 2:55 and the staff acted as if we were a week early. I was told your room isn't ready, I stood there for over 5 minutes without futher explanation. Eventually after some time passed and it was now past 3, they said they had a room for us. As if it was really a burden. I asked if they could call a cab for us and the man hesitated until I eventually said I would do it. Similar service experiences punctuated our entire visit. Again the rooms are charming. (The views however are not. Ours featured a car body shop and a parking lot. So if the view is important consider staying somewhere else.) The service is definately in the needs improvement category. Not what I expect for a $200 room. Note: I rate this hotel above average based on the decor, cleanliness and amenties of the room, which are more important to me than service. If I weighed service as more valuable I would give this hotel a below average.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around!”
Reviews.Author: valueseeker1
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Watertown made our visit to Seattle an all around great experience. We loved the interior decorating, very contemporary and upscale; comfortable rooms with good natural lighting. Watertown offers so many amenities and we enjoyed them all: the excellent continental breakfast, evening wine tasting, fitness room, cookies at the front desk, "a la carte" game cart, free parking. We took advantage of the complimentary loaner bikes too; we biked through University of Washington and the Arboretum nearby and really enjoyed the local neighborhood. The staff was so very helpful each day. An excellent value. We highly recommend the Watertown!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kivablue
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at this hotel. The room was super clean and the staff were amazingly friendly. They had lots of extras (which I love!): cool shampoo, soap, etc., and the Ala Cart is a wonderful (and free!) touch. I submitted a comment card because I thought they did an outstanding job and they sent me a personal letter saying 'Thank You'! I have never experienced such great customer service. You'll be impressed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Our Car Liked it Best”
Reviews.Author: mkedan
Reviews.Content: Let's be upfront here. The whole point of the Watertown can be summed up by "boutique-ish hotel with convenient and free parking." My friends who are sales reps swear by it, so when my work associates and I scheduled a couple of days in Seattle, it seemed like a good choice. The room is newish, looks a bit like an apartment. The windows open. I wasn't crazy about the storage space. The decor is simple. There's a microwave. You can pretend (the way some of my friends do) that you are not on vacation, but actually live in the city you are visiting. OK, so you live in the student ghetto. But there are about a half dozen teriyaki stands to choose from; what more did you want? It's a short drive to better restaurants on Capital Hill. The cart system is clever, but the computer cart is somewhat unworkable. It's hard to comfortbly use. A computer room would work better. My work friends love free hotel breakfasts so let me say it was appreciated by some. For me, eh. Really, it's all about the free parking and easy freeway access. And for tourist stuff, downtown is better.

Reviews.Title: “Definately a unique urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewers were right on the overall cleanliness, decor, amenities of the hotel and the low scale ethnic eateries around the neighborhood. I would like to add my comments on the "ala cart" amenities and the staff. I agree with some reviews that the "ala cart" does not offer much practical sense. It is somewhat gimmicky. We ordered a movie cart and when it arrived, my husband and I looked at each other and started laughing ( go to their website and see it yourself). It also appeared that there was only one cart for every a la cart item. We couldn't get the spa cart because someone already got it for the night. The staffs are friendly but they also seem extremely busy. The night we checked in, only one front desk personnel was on duty. He was very busy answering MULTIPLE phone calls while checking us him. When we called down for the morning call service, a young guy on the other line was yarning. I believe most staffs are students. In some way we felt like we were staying at a training hotel. For its price, the hotel is of great value but a rental car is a must if you want to do some sightseeing. A morning jog around the campus was a surprising pleasure-- -beautiful architecture, landscape, and gardens. I visited the reading room in the Suzzallo Library and walked through the waterfront trail around the Union Bay. Both were stunning in their own way--one is man-made and the other is natural. Would I stay here next time? Definitely, if I were on a business trip. If I were in Seattle with family for a vacation, I would stay somewhere else because the decor though hippy does not render a sense of warmth and coziness.

Reviews.Title: “This Cool hotel lost me with the Uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Most of the other reviews hit the nail on the head. This hotel is hip and unlike any other you have ever been too. The furnishings are unusual and kind of fun. The cart program is kind of cool, but more gimmicky than practical. The location is not ideal for tourist activities, but a rental car (free parking) can easily solve that. The staff is courteous, but generally are a bit too busy (check-in and check-out were both over 5 minutes). The free continental breakfast is a nice touch, but not of superior quality. The fitness room is VERY small and not private (it opens to the breakfast area and has sidewalk-level windows in a busy college area). Unfortunately, a comfortable bed can make or break a hotel. We stayed in a suite, and our bed was EXTREMELY uncomfortable. To add to the coolness factor, the mattress was placed on a solid wood block with no boxspring. This made for a mattress that progressively felt firmer the longer you slept on it. The worst feeling in the world is to cut your sleep short in the morning because its just too uncomfortable. It took about an hour or so to work the kinks out of our back. In all, this hotel has a laundry list of things going for it. However, only the hotel and room decor is where they appear to have gone "the extra mile." Everything else appears to have been added to bolster its amenities list, but not a whole lot of PRACTICAL thought went with it. For me, I wouldn't plan a lengthy vacation at this hotel as the coolness factor will wear out in about 2 days. What you will be left with is a longing for traditional amenities in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Iravros
Reviews.Content: I spend about 60 nights a year away from home and this place has just jumped to the top of my list. Not only is it sylish and smartly appointed, I love not being nickled and dimed to death- parking, breakfast, wi-fi, loaner bikes, bottled water, microwave, frige, even their cool "carts" (see their site) all included. I wish they were everywhere I had to go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Watertown!!”
Reviews.Author: dtra49
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Watertown for the second time. Rooms are nicely designed and furnished. It has free parking in an underground garage and I was able to get to Seattle Center in ten minutes and downtown in less than twenty minutes during morning commuting hours. There was a terrific restaurant a block away for breakfast and lunch which also caters for the hotel cocktail area during dinner with a free wine-tasting offered. It was a terrific value, with very helpful employees and I plan to stay there the next time I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a restaurant”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganBCTraveler
Reviews.Content: Based on my reviews from tripadvisor, we just got back from a spring break weekend at the Watertown hotel. The hotel is good accommodation for the price. My only complaint is the lack of any restaurants close by. The closest is three fairly long blocks uphill and it’s not in a neighborhood that most people would find really comfortable walking at night. If you want any kind of variety, you have to drive. We also spent several frustrating minuets trying to find Ivor’s even with good directions provided by the hotel. Driving around lost, under the I5 Bridge at night was not my idea of fun. The breakfast provided is continental only. If you want a real breakfast, again you have to drive. I might be back, but I’m going to keep looking for a hotel with better eating choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not our kind of place.”
Reviews.Author: bfrazier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown based primarily on reviews here at TripAdvisor. We generally like boutique hotels and had stayed at competitor boutique hotels in Seattle before. This was a larger room than its competition with some nice amenities, but we were a bit disappointed with the accommodations overall. Beds are indeed comfortable, and the rooms are neat and clean, though the cleanliness of the bedspreads is indeed dubious. We liked the in room safe and the extra cabinet space near the bathroom. The closet was too small for a five-day stay. Our worst problems dealt with transportation to and from downtown – of course there is the Watertown Shuttle - be advised it only holds six, stops only at predetermined locations and consequently negated any value of having a shuttle in the first place. Without the shuttle, the Watertown location becomes a poor fit for visitors who need access to downtown. The young lady at the counter said “Most people who need to go down town stay down there… well that was honest at least – wish I’d have known that earlier. TripAdvisor reviews mentioned nice views from the upper floors – apparently the newer buildings between the water and the Watertown to the south and west have negated most of that view. From our 5th floor southwest corner room we couldn’t see much of anything except dingy rooftops – really pretty disappointing. We don’t know if this hotel should rate as Seatle's number one accomodation (as it currently is) or not, however if this is the best Seattle has to offer visitors should consider another town.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No detail is overlooked at Watertown -- from the architecture, to the amenities, to the friendly and helpful staff. The loaner bikes (not clunkers, but nice wheels) are a great touch. My only complaint (albeit a minor one when compared to the so many things that Watertown does so well) is that the fitness center is not quite up to snuff with the balance of the hotel -- it could use a little more space and equipment. Watertown has all the spark of a boutique hotel, without the overly self-conscious emphasis on being "cool."
